NOTE:
  • Eureka Patch 1 Hot Fix 1 is an internal hot fix.
  • Eureka Patch 1 Hot Fix 3 does not exist.
  • Eureka Patch 1 Hot Fix 5 was retired and replaced by Eureka Patch 1 Hot Fix 6.
  • Eureka Patch 2 Hot Fix 1 is for Express customers only.
  • Eureka Patch 3 was retired and replaced by Eureka Patch 3 Hot Fix 1.
  • Eureka Patch 6 Hot Fix 3 does not exist.
  • Eureka Patch 6 Hot Fix 4 is for Express customers only.
  • Eureka Patch 9 was retired and replaced by Eureka Patch 9 Hot Fix 4.
  • Eureka Patch 10 Hot Fix 9 does not exist.

15 Feedback

Feedback is encouraged and helps us improve our documentation. Please click the Feedback tab at the top of this page to leave a comment about the release notes.

16 Legal Notices

Use of the ServiceNow product is subject to your subscription service agreement with ServiceNow. The product may interface with third party products, and you agree to the terms with such third party with respect to your use of the third party product, and ServiceNow is not a party to that agreement. You must separately purchase all third party products.

Third-party products utilized by features in this release include:

  • Twilio Services provided by Twilio, required by Notify
  • Okta single-sign-on solution provided Okta, Inc., required by Okta SSO Integration

</noinclude>

Eureka Patch 6 Hotfix 2

The Eureka Patch 6 Hot Fix 2 release provides fixes for the Eureka release.

Category Problem Description
Automation Services PRB611165
KB0542600 		Workflow will not start if the input variables do not match
Core Platform PRB611903 Certain plugins not available after upgrade to Eureka Patch 6 Hot Fix 1
Domain Support PRB610442 Use Record Domain property is not honored for a Delegated Administration only configuration
Domain Support PRB604006 Four domain properties missing from Domain Configuration module
Eureka Patch 6

The Eureka Patch 6 release provides fixes for the Eureka release.

Category Problem Short Description
Business Logic Processing PRB608323 [Express] Business rule does not save when there is a [same as] condition for a date/time field.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Add a custom date/time field to the Incident [incident] table.
  2. Create a new business rule as follows:
    • When to Run: [Task Type] [is] [Incident]
    • Actions: [<date/time field>] [same as] [<any field>]
  3. Save the business rule.
  4. Reload the business rule.
    The action reverts to the following:
    • When to Run: [Task Type] [is] [Incident]
    • Actions: [<date/time field>] [same as] [approval set]
Business Service Management Map PRB588105 A view of a CI in the Flat Layout format does not show all relationships if that CI has one related level where only one CI can be reached from multiple relationship paths.
CMDB PRB599765 CMDB business rules create so many log messages that other log messages become hard to find.
Discovery PRB568836 KB0522986 Discovery and Orchestration probes that run against Windows systems return incorrect values instead of valid non-ASCII characters.
Discovery PRB604546 Environment variables are not allowed to be passed to a script. Therefore they can not be made available in a Powershell script.
Discovery PRB607776 The field that stores the query string for Computer Identity does not contain enough characters to hold long entries. This affects users that have a ServiceNow instance hosted on an Oracle database and use the Microsoft SCCM 2012 Configuration Manager.
Email PRB596710 KB0541452 The email property glide.pop3.reply_separators does not register trailing spaces.

Notable Change: The glide.pop3.reply_separators property is enhanced to support unicode encoding, which enables the property to register trailing spaces.

Email PRB608307 KB0542146 If an email address is specified as a notification recipient and the address matches a user's email address, but has different capitalization, a null pointer exception may occur.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Open any incident record.
  2. Add ABel.tuter@example.com to the watch list.
  3. Enter text in the Additional comments field and save the record.
  4. Navigate to System Logs > System Log > Errors.
    You will see the following:
java.lang.NullPointerException: java.lang.NullPointerException: com.glide.notification.cmn.NotificationRecipients.getIncludedUserLog(NotificationRecipients.java:580)
com.glide.notification.cmn.NotificationMessage.enqueue(NotificationMessage.java:235)
com.glide.notification.cmn.NotificationMessage.send(NotificationMessage.java:210)
com.glide.notification.cmn.NotificationActionHandler.send(NotificationActionHandler.java:63)
com.glide.notification.cmn.NotificationActionHandler.process(NotificationActionHandler.java:41)
com.glide.policy.EventProcessor.processEventDuringNormalOperation(EventProcessor.java:163)
com.glide.policy.EventProcessor.processEvent(EventProcessor.java:100)
com.glide.policy.EventProcessor.process(EventProcessor.java:66)
com.glide.policy.EventManager.processEvents(EventManager.java:215)
com.glide.policy.EventManager.process(EventManager.java:125)
com.glide.script.GlideSystem.js_eventsProcess(GlideSystem.java:618)
inv43.invoke()
org.mozilla.javascript.FunctionObject.doInvoke(FunctionObject.java:565)
org.mozilla.javascript.FunctionObject.call(FunctionObject.java:480)
org.mozilla.javascript.ScriptRuntime.call(ScriptRuntime.java:1196)
org.mozilla.javascript.gen.c368.call(<refname>:1)
org.mozilla.javascript.gen.c368.exec(<refname>)
com.glide.script.ScriptEvaluator.execute(ScriptEvaluator.java:173)
com.glide.script.ScriptEvaluator.evaluateString(ScriptEvaluator.java:67)
com.glide.script.ScriptEvaluator.evaluateStringWithPrefix(ScriptEvaluator.java:43)
com.glide.script.Evaluator.evaluatePossiblePrefixedString(Evaluator.java:240)
com.glide.job.RunScriptJob.evaluateScript(RunScriptJob.java:136)
com.glide.job.RunScriptJob.execute(RunScriptJob.java:81)
com.glide.schedule.JobExecutor.execute(JobExecutor.java:72)
com.glide.schedule.GlideScheduleWorker.executeJob(GlideScheduleWorker.java:177)
com.glide.schedule.GlideScheduleWorker.process(GlideScheduleWorker.java:124)
com.glide.schedule.GlideScheduleWorker.run(GlideScheduleWorker.java:56)
Email PRB605536
KB0542147 		In UI14, the email client Spelling icon does not work.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Ensure the email client is enabled for the Incident [incident] table.
  2. Open any incident.
  3. In the form header, click the email icon.
  4. In the email client window, enter a message with spelling mistakes.
  5. In the toolbar, click the Spelling icon.
    Note that nothing happens.
Import / Export PRB600356
KB0541344 		When you export an import template and save the file locally, the import template is blank when a related list is included.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Navigate to the Incident List view and personalize the List Layout
  2. Add a caller and save the record.
  3. Navigate to list all the Open Incidents, right-click the form header, and select Import
  4. Select 'Insert' and click on Create Excel Template
  5. Select Download to download the template.
Import / Export PRB608464 When using mapping assist for a new transformation map you cannot recreate removed fields.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Go to any transform map.
  2. Remove fields from field related list view.
  3. Now go to mapping assist and add back the same fields.
  4. Click save.
  5. The related list view below will only show one field.
Incident Management PRB603157 KB0539241 The Show related incidents UI macro works on the caller_id field only in Dublin and later releases.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Open any incident record.
  2. Right-click the Location field and select Personalize Dictionary.
  3. In the Attributes field, enter tree_picker=true,ref_contributions=user_show_incidents.
  4. Click Update.
  5. Navigate to Incident > Create New.
  6. Set the Location to any value.
  7. Click Submit.
  8. Navigate to Incident > Create New.
  9. Set the Location to the same value as in the previous incident.
  10. Right-click the form header and select Save.
  11. Click the Show related incidents icon beside the Location field.
    Note that no results are displayed.
  12. In our Calgary builds, the list renders as expected with both new Incidents in place. In the Dublin builds, no results return, since the updated user_show_incidents Macro hard codes the field to caller_id rather than letting this be variable based on the associated field.
Integrations PRB597627 The Google Maps integration displays multiple Client ID property fields.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Navigate to System Properties > Google Maps.
  2. The properties page displays duplicate copies of the field Client ID for Google Maps API for Business. To obtain your own key, visit http://www.google.com/enterprise/earthmaps/maps.html for details..
MID Server PRB601964 Running a Perl script on the MID Server (via a Scheduled Job) does not return the STDOUT.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce

1. Run the following script on the MID Server file system (for example, /tmp/script.pl).

Ensure that the MID Server user can execute this script.
#!/usr/bin/perl
use strict;
use warnings;
print "Hello ServiceNow!";

2. On the instance, navigate to System Definitions > Scheduled Jobs > New.
3. Set the job to run On Demand and enter this script, replacing Mid1@Centos1 in ecc.agent with the name of your MID Server: 

var ecc = new GlideRecord('ecc_queue');
ecc.initialize();
ecc.agent = 'mid.server.Mid1@Centos1';
ecc.topic = 'Command';
ecc.queue = 'output';
ecc.payload = '<parameters><parameter name="name" value="/tmp/script.py"/><parameter name="skip_sensor" value="true"/></parameters>';
ecc.insert();

4. Click Execute Now.

If this UI action is not visible, personalize the form to add it.

5. Wait approximately 2 minutes until the message has been processed by the MID Server.
6. Navigate to ECC > Queue and search the message returned by the MID Server.

You can fine tune the search with these values:
  • Topic: Command
  • Queue: input
  • Name: /tmp/script.py

7. Open the message and click XML to view the formatted payload.

Notice that the results are empty. The expected behavior is that stdout should contain Hello ServiceNow!
<result command="/tmp/script.pl">
<stdout/>
<stderr/>
</result>
Mobile Browser PRB601210 Application navigator separators do not appear in the tablet interface.
Platform PRB596778 [Express] Template values for a standard change definition do not save as default in form.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. On the system administrator homepage, select Service Catalog > Catalog Definition > Record Producers.
  2. Select Server Reboot.
  3. Under the Generated Record Data tab, add State = Ready.
  4. Click Try It below the template value header or from the form header.
    The Schedule a Server Reboot page appears.
  5. Click Submit.
    The default value for the State field is now Draft. Based on the previous steps, the default value should be Ready.
Platform Miscellaneous PRB597203 Translated values revert to the English value when a table contains more than one field of the type Translated Text.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Create a new table with two string fields of type Translated Text.
  2. Create a record in the table.
  3. Change to a non-English language.
  4. Open the record you previously created and update with the translation.
  5. Save the record.
  6. Re-open the record, update one of the fields, and save the record.
  7. Notice that the other field resets from the translation back to the English value.
Platform Miscellaneous PRB593160 KB0540100 Use of Native Regular Expressions is inefficient and can lead to an outage.
Platform Miscellaneous PRB604506 Price fields display incorrect currency symbol for the Swiss franc.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Change the system property glide.system.locale to de.CH.
  2. Create a new Price field and add it to a list.
  3. Navigate to the list and notice the currency symbol for the Price field.
    Expected: The currency symbol for the Swiss franc should be CHF.
    Actual: The Price symbol for Swiss franc is [SFr.].
Platform Miscellaneous PRB606497 System cannot attach files containing uppercase file type extensions, even if listed in the glide.attachment.extensions property.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Populate glide.attachment.extensions to contain a named extension both uppercase and lowercase (JPG,jpg).
  2. Open a record that inherits from task.
  3. Attach the file with lowercase extension. It will be attached.
  4. Attach the file with uppercase extension. The attachment fails to load and the system displays the alert JPG is not an authorized file extension.
Platform Performance PRB601306 Excessive number of errors in logs: QuotaManager: Exception - 45037 log entries created today.
Project Management PRB607583 General data exception when new projects are created.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Navigate to Project > Projects > Create New.
  2. Fill out the fields on the form.
  3. Click Save.
Reporting PRB608743 The Same Day report condition excludes items with a duration of zero.
Reporting PRB607574 Alignment inconsistency with IE and Chrome.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Create a new report on the Incident [incident] table using default columns.
  2. Filter on reports created on today.
  3. Observe the differences with Chrome and IE.
Service Catalog PRB606581
KB0541876 		Catalog item Name is not translated when displayed in the Shopping Cart section on catalog item or category pages.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Activate any language plugin.
    This creates translated text [sys_translated_text] records in the other language.
  2. Change the session language to the newly activated language. For example, gs.getSession().setLanguage("fr");
  3. Open an item in the service catalog.
  4. Click Add to cart.
    Note that the item name is not translated in the Shopping Cart.
Service Catalog PRB603603 KB0541237 The Continue Shopping button in the CMS opens in a frame and the UI has to break out.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Open an item or category in CMS.
  2. Click Continue Shopping.
    This temporarily opens the whole screen (left bar, title bar and content) inside the content frame. The frame buster code will activate quickly so that the screen is loaded in the whole browser. Sometimes this happens too quickly but sometimes you may see that content.
Service Catalog PRB606577 KB0540772 The order of variable sets is not displayed correctly.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Add more than one variable set to any catalog item.
  2. Order the variable set
  3. Use Try It to verify the order of the variable sets.
Service Catalog PRB604475 Content item opens within catalog when the target configuration is set to open in new window.
Service Catalog PRB606869 Variables with long Question names do not text wrap for service catalog items.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Create a new catalog item or use an existing catalog item. For example, Apple iPad 3.
  2. Create a set of variables such as:
    • Container Start - order 10
    • Single Line Text - order 20 - Question: [Enter large amount of text. For example, use over 100 characters]
    • Container Split - order 30
    • Single Line Text - order 40 - Question: [Again, enter large amount of text]
    • Container End - order 50
  3. Test the catalog item.
    Note that, especially with the split, you have to scroll across to access and see these question names.
Service Catalog PRB606767 Order Guides bad (duplicated) sysparm_active / sysparm_complete_tabs parameters in the URI
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Create three catalog items: Item1, Item2, Item3.
  2. Add a mandatory variable to each of the items.
  3. Create an order guide called Order Guide 1.
  4. In the Rule base related list, add the three items.
  5. Go to the catalog and start order Order Guide 1.
  6. Click Choose Options.
  7. Open a packet sniffer or any other tool that lets you see the http messages between your browser and the server.
  8. For Item1, complete the form (1 variable) and click on the second tab (Item2).
  9. Observe in the debugger, the query string in the GET request to http://<server>/com.glideapp.servicecatalog_cat_item_guide_view.do?....
    sysparm_guide:ff92ae3047322100a2d042b07ee490ad
    sysparm_active:8fbe123047322100a2d042b07ee490e5
    sysparm_complete_tabs:c3aed23047322100a2d042b07ee490b6
    sysparm_incomplete_tabs:8fbe123047322100a2d042b07ee490e5,42ce523047322100a2d042b07ee49047
    Observe that there 1 tab is complete, 2 incomplete.
  10. For Item2, complete the form (1 variable) and click on the 3rd tab (Item3).
  11. Observe the GET query in the debugger:
    sysparm_guide:ff92ae3047322100a2d042b07ee490ad
    sysparm_active:42ce523047322100a2d042b07ee49047
    sysparm_complete_tabs:c3aed23047322100a2d042b07ee490b6,8fbe123047322100a2d042b07ee490e5
    sysparm_incomplete_tabs:42ce523047322100a2d042b07ee49047,42ce523047322100a2d042b07ee49047
    Observe that there are 2 tabs complete and 2 incomplete. There should be 2 tabs complete and 1 incomplete.
Service Catalog PRB601994 Variable set order is not set correctly, which causes unexpected behavior in the layout.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Create a variable set with Order set to 100.
  2. Create two variables inside the variable set:
    • Variable 1: Order of 100
    • Variable 2: Order of 200
  3. Create the following variables:
    • Container Start: Order of 100 and Layout 2 Columns Wide, alternating sides
    • Container End: Order of 156
    • Single Line Text Variables: Orders of 115 and 120
Service Catalog PRB604122 Container and label variables are not correctly formatted on requested item records when submitted from an order guide if the order guide tab is not visited.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Create an order guide with four or five tabs (rule bases).
  2. Create a variable set with around 10 variables with multiple labels and container starts and ends. Ensure you do not make any of the variables mandatory.
  3. Add the variable set to all of the order guide items such that they will appear on all of the tabs defined in step 1.
  4. Run the order guide.
    Be careful to only visit one or two of the tabs and note which tabs you have visited.
  5. Submit the order.
  6. Visit each of the spawned requested item records (RITMs).
    Notice the RITMs associated with the tabs that were not visited in the order guide. The variables (labels and containers) will not render correctly on the RITM form. The RITMs that are associated with tabs that were visited in the order guide will render the variables correctly.
Service Catalog PRB606514 If there is a check box variable with an associated price, it does not work to use g_form.setValue() on that check box for order guides.
Software Asset Management PRB609375 Deleting the Software Installation record does not delete the Software Counter Detail related record.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Navigate to Software Asset Management > Reconciliation > Software Counters.
  2. Open any Software Counters record, such as Microsoft Skype 5.0.
  3. Right-click the header and select Personalize > Related List.
  4. Select Software Counter Detail > Software counter to the selected list collector.
  5. Click Save.
  6. Click on the software install record under the Software Counter Details related list.
  7. Click the Delete UI Action.
    Notice that on the Software Counter record, the Software Counter Detail record still exists, but the Software Install field value is now empty. This behavior differs from the behavior within Calgary and the Dublin releases, since the Remove cached flag business rule on the Software Installation [cmdb_sam_sw_install] table has changed in Eureka.
Tables and Dictionary PRB607754 Setting the glide.ui.list_edit property to false prevents users from updating the Table [sys_db_object] table.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. In the navigation filter, enter sys_properties.list.
  2. Set the glide.ui.list_edit property to false.
  3. Navigate to System Definition > Tables.
  4. Click New.
  5. In the Label field, enter Test.
  6. Allow the Name and User role fields to auto-populate.
  7. Clear the Create module check box.
  8. Click Submit.
  9. In the list view, open the the Test table.
  10. Change the table label to test01.
  11. Click Update.
    You will receive the following error:
onSubmit script error: TypeError: Cannot read property 'length' of undefined:
function onSubmit() {
    if(!g_form.getActionName().startsWith('sysverb_update'))
        return true;
    if (g_form.isNewRecord()) {
        return true;
    }
    if (gFormAlreadySubmitted) {
        return true;
    }
    var properties = new EnterOnceProperties();
    var table = $$('table.list_table')[0];
    if (table != null) {
        properties.checkList(table, onComplete);
        return false;
    }
    return true;
}
UI Policy/Client Script PRB607184 When a UI policy uses an [is one of] condition on a field that contains a -- None -- option, selecting the -- None -- option causes the UI policy to evaluate to True.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Create a new UI policy with the following values:
    • Table: Incident [incident]
    • Conditions: [Category] [is one of] [Software] AND [Active] [is] [true]
  2. Create a UI policy action with revert if false. For example, make Number mandatory.
  3. Test the UI policy by creating a new change. Leave Category set to -- None-- and change the value of the Risk field.
    Note that Number becomes mandatory even though the Category is not set to Software.
Upgrades PRB606403 KB0542108 The baseline UI action sys_approval is deleted when upgrading from Dublin to Eureka.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Upgrade from Dublin Patch 1 to Eureka Patch 3 HF 1.
  2. Post upgrade, the history log shows a delete when you look for the approve UI action in the XML.
Upgrades PRB605384 When upgrading to Eureka, updated records on sysrule_assignment are overwritten.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Make a note of the value of sysrule_assignment.group where sys_id = d62c8c27c0a801670089269e33e4f5cc.
  2. On a pre-Eureka instance with demo data, delete Service Desk group.
  3. sysrule_assignment.group where sys_id = d62c8c27c0a801670089269e33e4f5cc is now empty.
  4. Upgrade to Eureka, and wait for the upgrade to complete.
  5. The value of sysrule_assignment.group where sys_id = d62c8c27c0a801670089269e33e4f5cc is now a sys_id of a deleted group.
User Interface (UI) PRB607769 Browser right-click function does not work in UI14 list column search fields.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Ensure UI14 is enabled.
  2. Navigate to any list.
  3. Click the search icon to display column search fields.
  4. Right-click in the search field.
    A ServiceNow context menu appears instead of the browser's right-click menu.
User Interface (UI) PRB603826 Reference field display values are not translated in breadcrumbs.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce

Prerequisites:

  1. Activate any language plugin.
  2. Create a table called Translation Test [u_translation_test].
  3. Add a field of the Translated Text type called Name.
  4. Change the Display value of the table to the Name field.
  5. Create some records on the table and fill in the Name field.
  6. Add some translations for the Name field.
  7. On the Incident [incident] table, create a field called Name Reference that references the Name field on the Translation Test table. Ensure the field appears on the form.

Steps to reproduce:

  1. Navigate to Incident > All.
  2. Personalize the list and add the Name Reference field.
  3. Open any incident record.
  4. In the Name Reference field, select a translation test record.
  5. Repeat the steps above.
  6. In the language picker, select a different language than the current one.
  7. Navigate to Incident > All. (The labels will vary according to language.)
  8. Locate an incident that has a Name Reference value.
  9. Right-click the Name Reference value and select Show Matching.
    The Name Reference value is not translated in the breadcrumbs as expected.
User Interface (UI) PRB577851 Embedded list control loads all records for the list, which can cause OutOfMemory errors.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Create a new relationship as follows:
    • Name: Choose a memorable name
    • Applies to table: User [sys_user]
    • Queries from table: History [sys_history_line]
    • Query with: current.addQuery('user', parent.sys_id);
  2. Navigate to sys_user.do.
  3. On the User form, right-click the form header and select Personalize > Form Layout.
  4. Use the slushbucket to add the relationship you created as an embedded list.
  5. Open the user record for a system administrator or any user with many history updates.
  6. Set a debug breakpoint in ListEditGet.java on the getQueryResponse() method.
    This breakpoint will be called for every record available regardless of limit, and the xml response will include all of them as well.
User Interface (UI) PRB570882 A glide list field does not display values on a form when the field is read-only and the glide.ui.glide_list.start.locked property is false.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Create a field of the List type on the Incident form.
  2. Open an incident record and save a value in the new field.
  3. Sign in as a user with the itil role and open the recently edited incident record.
    Note that the value in the list field does not display.
User Interface (UI) PRB603214 Removing the Suggestion light bulb icon from the incident Short description field partially hides the Search Knowledge icon.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Ensure UI14 is enabled.
  2. Open an incident record.
  3. Right-click the Short description field and select Personalize Dictionary.
  4. In the Choice field, change the value from Suggestion to -- None --.
  5. Click Update.
    Note that the light bulb icon is no longer beside the Short description field but that the Search Knowledge icon is partially hidden.
  6. Resize the window.
    Note that the Search Knowledge icon is still partially hidden.
User Interface (UI) PRB606204 In IE11, when UI14 is enabled, multiple items cannot be moved up and down in a slushbucket.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Ensure compatibility mode is off.
  2. Navigate to a list of incidents.
  3. Right-click a list column header and select Personalize > List Layout.
  4. Select a column name on the right side of the slushbucket to move UP or DOWN.
  5. Select another column name from the slushbucket.
    Note that the column name is not selectable.
User Interface (UI) PRB607589 In IE11, module labels wrap in the application navigator.
User Interface (UI) PRB604196 For script fields in full screen mode, long lines do not wrap.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Open a record with a script field, such as a business rule.
  2. In the script tool bar click on the Toggle Full Screen Mode icon.
  3. Enter a very long string.
    Note that the line does not wrap.
User Interface (UI) PRB604135 In TinyMCE version 4 fields, the choice menu is not available for bulleted or numbered list type selection.
User Interface (UI) PRB605446 Workflow activity pop-up contains unnecessary scroll bar.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Navigate to Workflow > Workflow Editor.
  2. Open any workflow.
  3. Double-click an activity.
    Notice that a scroll bar is present.
User Interface (UI) PRB607995 [Express] The Form Designer plugin is missing, which causes jelly exceptions when attempting to personalize forms.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Navigate to a user record.
  2. Right-click the form header and select Personalize > Form Design.
  3. Add fields to the form and save.
  4. Navigate to the form again.
    A blank page appears.
User Interface (UI) PRB608553 If you are a user whose name contains an apostrophe and you use the Add me icon to add yourself to a watch list, the system inserts a backslash before the apostrophe. For example, if you add Valentine D'Granberry to a watch list, the name is displayed as Valentine D\'Granberry. The backslash disappears after you save the record.
User Interface (UI) PRB607333 In UI14, a horizontal scroll bar appears unnecessarily in many forms.
User Interface (UI) PRB609945 Order Status - 'Back to Catalog' and 'Continue Shopping' buttons don't work
Visual Task Boards PRB604415 KB0539924 Assignment policies can be violated by using visual task boards.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Create a new incident and set the Assignment group to Database.
  2. In the Incident list, right-click the Priority column header and select Show Visual Task Board.
  3. In the visual task board that appears, drag the avatar for David Loo onto the card for the incident you just created.
    Note that the incident is assigned to David Loo even though he is not in the Database assignment group.
Visual Task Boards PRB606821 Visual Task Boards menu does not work when the instance language is set to French Canadian.
Visual Task Boards PRB608678 Visual task boards do not honor data policies or UI policies.
Visual Task Boards PRB605307 KB0540258 Once a task has been archived from a visual task board, it is not possible to add the task back to the board by using the Add to Visual Task Board action, even if the board is a selectable option.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Create a freeform task board.
  2. Create a task card in any lane.
  3. Click the new task to view the details and note the task number.
  4. Click Archive Card.
  5. Perform a global search for the task number.
    The task record opens automatically.
  6. Right-click the form header and select Add to Visual Task Board.
  7. Select the board you created.
  8. Open the board you created.
    Note that the task does not appear.
Visual Task Boards PRB607876 KB0542083 Visual task boards break when board owners add themselves to the member list.
Visual Task Boards PRB607046 KB0542084 Visual task boards with filters containing computed values are unstable when accessed by multiple users.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Create a visual task board on the Incident [incident] table with a filter condition of submitter=javascript:gs.getUserID().
  2. Move some task cards around.
  3. Add a different user to the board as a member.
  4. Sign in as the new board member and open the board.
  5. Sign back in as the first user.
    Note that the cards have returned to their original positions.
Visual Task Boards PRB608375 KB0542081 Visual task board user preferences are not stored correctly when the Mobile UI plugin is not activated.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Navigate to Self Service > My Task Boards.
    The welcome screen appears.
  2. Close the welcome screen.
  3. Create a new task board.
    A tool tip appears that describes freeform boards.
  4. Repeat the previous steps.
    Note that the welcome screen and tool tip appear again.
Web Services PRB603943 Cannot insert or update journal fields using JSONv2.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Test scenarios in DUBLIN ONLY:
  1. FAILS:
  2. =
  3. JSONv2:
  4. https://<INSTANCE_NAME>.service-now.com/incident.do?JSONv2&sysparm_query=sys_id=<SYS_ID>&sysparm_action=update
  5. https://<INSTANCE_NAME>.service-now.com/incident.do?JSONv2&sysparm_sys_id=<SYS_ID>&sysparm_action=update
  6. BOTH succeed if field to be inserted / updated is not "comments" or "work_notes" (journal types(?))
  1. JSONv1
  2. https://<INSTANCE_NAME>.service-now.com/incident.do?JSON&sysparm_sys_id=<SYS_ID>&sysparm_action=update
  3. sysparm_sys_id" cannot be used with JSONv1 for inserts / updates.
  1. SUCCEEDS:
  2. =
  3. JSONv1:
  4. https://<INSTANCE_NAME>.service-now.com/incident.do?JSON&sysparm_query=sys_id=<SYS_ID>&sysparm_action=update
Workflow PRB605581 Starting subflow contexts creates extra wf_workflow records
Workflow PRB609881 KB0542095 Upgrading to Eureka Patch 5 moves Workflows into an unintended domain.
Workflow PRB604062 KB0541572 When a Rollback To activity is defined in a workflow which is running on a non-task table, the state of the approvals is not changed. Instead, the approvals are recreated.
Workflow PRB606305 Subflows can become stuck when executing a workflow containing multiple subflows.
Workflow PRB609233 The Approval Coordinator activity can get stuck in an infinite loop when attempting to delete duplicate approvers.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Enable option 2 in the SNC Approval - Reset conditions baseline business rule.
  2. Set the conditions in the script to always execute.
  3. Build a workflow on the Change Request [change_request] table with an approval coordinator and any set of approvals that generate a duplicate approval.
    Two user approvals with the same user are sufficient.
  4. Turn off all other business rules on the change_request table.
  5. Create a change request record and submit it.
  6. Modify this record in any way and update it.
Eureka Patch 5 Hot Fix 3 
 The Eureka Patch 5 Hotfix 3 release provides fixes for the Eureka release.
Category Problem Description
Persistence PRB614013 Outbound Web Services (which use HTTP Client) support TLS

The Eureka Patch 5 Hotfix 1 release provides fixes for the Eureka release.

Category Problem Description
Persistence PRB609589 Flattening upgrade fixes
Persistence PRB609448 Query optimization: order by on logical child table can be ignored to improve performance
Eureka Patch 5

The Eureka Patch 5 release provides fixes for the Eureka release.

Category Problem Short Description
Update Sets PRB567545
KB0541220 		Legacy sys_ui_policy_action.data_policy field breaks Update Set Preview
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Create an update set that contains a catalog UI policy that includes actions.
  2. Complete the update set and pull it to a second instance.
  3. Preview the update set.

Check the warnings log. Note displayed errors.

Email PRB606324 For a notification that is set to be sent to a group, if the group's Exclude manager field is false and there is no group Manager specified, the notification may locate a user record with a blank email address to use as a recipient.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Create a group with no Manager specified and the Exclude manager check box cleared.
    You may need to personalize the form to see the Exclude manager check box.
  2. Create an email notification and configure it to send to the group.
  3. Create a user record with no Email address specified.
  4. Trigger the notification.
  5. Review the log entries for the notification.
    Note that the user record with the empty email address was excluded or included. This means the user was considered as a possible recipient, which should not be the case.
Email PRB582911
KB0541200 		Delegates for notifications do not receive notifications if the notification is sent to a group
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Add a delegate to a test user and enable the delegate to receive notifications.
  2. Ensure that the delegate will receive notifications if the recipient field of the notification goes to one user. (For example, set the notification to send to the assigned_to.)
  3. Reset the notification to send to a group (for example, send to assignment_group), where the only member is the test user.
    Note that the delegate does not receive the email.
Form Rendering PRB590047
KB0529539 		When you enter long, unbreakable lines of text to a work not, the text does not wrap
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Open an existing incident.
  2. Enter a very long text string in the work notes field. The string should span several lines, but should not contain any spaces.
  3. Save the change.
Email PRB591475
KB0541095 		Emails from mailer-daemon are not ignored as expected
Service Catalog PRB592446
KB0535421 		The Continue Shopping button in the shopping cart redirects to incorrect an URL
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. In a demo instance, set the system property "glide.sc.continue.shopping.target" to "catalog_home.do?sysparm_view=catalog_default"
  2. Go to CMS page for that instance, then click Computers and Hardware under Order Things
  3. Click on any item (Desktop or Laptop) and click Add to cart.
  4. Click Continue Shopping.

Result: You get an error message: A view name can only contain A-Z, a-z, 0-9, and _

Platform Miscellaneous PRB593160
KB0540100 		Use of Native Regular Expressions is inefficient, can lead to outage
User Interface (UI) PRB594014
KB0534749 		In Dublin, tree picker will present a list, but when you click the + to expand them nothing is listed even if there are contents it should display
Discovery PRB594884 lr.sh is not Bourne compliant
Import / Export PRB595319 Import set fails during transformation process with java.lang.NullPointerException error
UI Policy/Client Script PRB595874 When an onSubmit client script returns false, a dirty form warning does not appear
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Load an xml file that contains a client script against incident that throws an alert when the impact value is 1 and will return false.
  2. Navigate to an existing incident
  3. Make changes to the record, ensuring that impact is not "1 - High"
  4. Click the green Back button in the header of the record. A warning is displayed that you are about to leave the page.
  5. Remain in the record and change the impact to "1 - High" and save the record. An alert from the client script is displayed
  6. Click the green Back button in the header of the record
Email PRB597470 Inbound email that contains text in the body appears blank in the activity log
User Interface (UI) PRB597758
KB0541217 		Cannot rearrange multiple fields in the personalize layout option using IE11
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Navigate to any Incident, Problem, or Change form.
  2. Right-click form header and select Personalize > Form Layout.
  3. Attempt to rearrange fields on the [Selected] box.

Result: After you arrange any field, you cannot select another field. The previous field is still selected.

User Interface (UI) PRB598308 Journal inputs do not word wrap in IE11 as you type (Microsoft textarea behavior change)
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. In Internet Explorer 11, open Developer Tools
  2. Set Document Mode to 9, 10, or Edge and go to any Journal-type field.
  3. Attempt to type.

Result: Word wrap does not work as text continues and scroll bar emerges.

Chat PRB601173 Chat (queue) error message disconnects previously held chat sessions
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Log in with two separate agents: agent1, agent2
  2. Initiate a chat with customer user: client1
  3. Allow agent1 to pick up the call from client1
  4. Initiate a chat with a second customer: client2
  5. Attempt to pick up the call with client2 with both agent1 and agent2

Result: If agent2 is successful in picking up the call, agent1 will receive an error message informing them that the customer is no longer queued. The error message renders the previous call for client1 inactive for agent1.

Integrations PRB602232 Task_Survey fails to update unless user is already logged into ServiceNow
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Enable email on an instance with SSO set up
  2. Turn on out of box surveys on tasks.
  3. Resolve / complete a task. You should receive an email to take a survey.
  4. Log out of the instance and click the link in your email.
  5. Take the survey and submit
  6. View the task_survey table. You should see that the "instance" field (survey_instance) is blank.
  7. View the "task_survey_detail" database view and search for the survey you just completed.
Platform PRB602395 Additional select statement causes performance to slow after upgrade to Dublin
Mobile Browser PRB602554 Loading a record from an table extended from task from the task view does not honor view rules in mobile.
User Interface (UI) PRB602562 Writeable dropdown lists appear the same as read-only dropdown lists in later version of Chrome in Eureka
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Open an existing incident using Chrome (for example, version 35.0.1916.153 or later).

Result: "Impact", "Urgency," and "Priority" all appear to be read-only. In this case, "Impact" and Urgency" can be changed, even though all the fields appear to be the same.

Mobile Browser PRB602616 [MobileUI] Reference qualifier script does not evaluate "current" variable
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Log in to an OOB instance and navigate to Create new incident form.
  2. Change the reference qualifier on task.assigned_to to "javascript:dosomething()"
  3. Create a global business rule:

Name: dosomething Script: function dosomething() { gs.print(current.getTableName()); return "roles=itil"; } Create a new incident on the normal full interface, and click on the Assigned to field. Returned records are based upon reference qualifier in step 1.

  1. Log in to the mobile interface using $m.do and navigate to Create a new incident.
  2. Click on the Assigned to field. All the records are returned and reference qualifier from step 1 is not honored
Mobile Browser PRB602676 Tablet Popup (reference icon) view freezes with a Processing message when there are too many variables on the item
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. In the target instance, go to Retrieved Update Sets and select Import Update Set from XML.
  2. Point to the new file that you created and perform normal update set preview procedures.

Note: Records might be marked as skipped. Change to Commit as necessary. Create a u_account_heirarchy table. TABLET: Locate the target Record Producer. TABLET: Click Try It. TABLET: Click the magnifying glass next. Result: Popup hangs with a Processing... message.

User Interface (UI) PRB603267 IE9 Eureka Short Description Field does not expand to fill width of screen when it has a choice list of Suggestion specified.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. In Internet Explorer 9, navigate to Incidents > Open Incidents
  2. Select any incident from list. Note that Short Description field does not stretch the length of the screen.
  3. Right-click short description label and choose Personalize Dictionary
  4. Verify the Short Description field is set with a choice list Suggestion
Domain Support PRB604100 After upgrade from Dublin to Eureka, UI actions from subdomain overwrite global UI actions, even if session is in global domain
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Install the MSP domain separation plugin in a Dublin instance.
  2. Set your session domain to TOP (instead of global).
  3. Edit the global submit UI action, change the name, and save the changes.

Result: A copy of the UI action is created in the top domain to overwrite the global UI action.

  1. Upgrade to Eureka.

Result: Even when the session is in the global domain, the TOP UI action appears instead.

Mobile Browser PRB604177 [Mobile] Integer type fields on forms are not saved when edited via mobile browser
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Log in to an out-of-the-box instance and create a field of type integer on any table
  2. Open a record on that table using the mobile browser and enter an integer value (e.g. 100) into that field using the mobile browser
  3. Save.
Workflow PRB604211 Business Rule selected to run only on update also runs on insert
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. On a Eureka instance, on the incident table, create a business rule on update only, run on before, and set the order to 10.
  2. Add a script to update the short description or display an Add Info message.
  3. Create a workflow on the incident and add a Set Value activity to update the Impact field
  4. Add a Run Script activity and set the flag "after_business_rules" field to true
  5. Create a new incident and save it.
Tables and Dictionary PRB604287 sys_dictionary custom field's 'Column Label' is empty
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. In a Dublin EA8 instance, create a custom field in the Dictionary for sc_task called u_test

Field Type: String Choice: Dropdown with --None-- Choice Table: sys_user_group Choice Field: name Max Length: 40

  1. Confirm the sys_storage_alias record was created, then delete the sys_storage_alias record
  2. Restart the instance and upgrade to Eureka Patch 3 Hotfix 1.

  2. Create many relationships between phases and many relationships between tasks.

Change Management PRB604584
KB0539963 		Change Management client script [Planned End Date Validation] broken on specific time format [dd-MM-yyyy]

  2. Navigate to the sys_properties.LIST, glide.sys.date_format and change the value to [dd-MM-yyyy]
  3. Navigate to Change request > Create New and select the Planned start date as today, and the Planned end date in the future
  4. Save or submit the change request.

gs.print(new DictionaryChoiceTables().process().length -1);

Reporting PRB606292 ACLs with operation report_on prevent reports from being rendered
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Create an ACL (Type: record, Operation: report_on, name: <a_table>.None)
  2. Add a condition to the script that is not met for some users (ex. !gs.hasRole('itil'); ). All users who do not have ITIL role should not have rights to modify/create reports on the table <a_table>.
  3. Create a report on <a_table> and impersonate a user who is not meeting the requirements of the ACL created at step 1, and try to render the report.
Orchestration (RBA) PRB606336 "The configured default MID Server is not available" error occurs when an Orchestration activity attempts to use the default MID server when language is not English
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Enable Orchestration plugin.
  2. Enable I18N plugin ‚Äì any language will be OK, for example "com.snc.i18n.german".
  3. Set a MID server (do not configure capability and IP) and set it as default MID. Make sure the MID server is running.
  4. Create a workflow has SSH Run Command activity. For example, set command to "ls" to list all files on the target machine.
  5. Set up credential, which can access the target machine.
  6. Check the instance language is set to "English" (by default).
  7. Run the workflow and make sure the Run Command activity runs successfully.
  8. Change the instance language to the German.
  9. Run the workflow. The Run Command activity will fail with error message "The configured default MID Server (debug) is not available".

Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Activate the plugin com.glideapp.password_reset and load demo data
  2. Configure a Password Reset process allowing public access and enabling account unlock
  3. Choose a user and set the "Locked out" field to true
  4. In a new browser session, perform the password reset process, choosing the locked out user.
  5. In the last step, instead of resetting the password, click on the "Unlock Account" button

  4. Create a new CMS page: Content Management > Pages > New > CMS Test Page > Submit
  5. Delete the new CMS page: Content Management > Pages > CMS Test Page > Delete
  6. Complete/export the update set: Local Update Set > update State to Complete > Export to XML
