Eureka Patch 4 Hot Fix 5

The Eureka Patch 4 Hotfix 5 release provides fixes for the Eureka release.

Category Problem Description
Apps - Performance Analytics PRB619176 Records tab content of a Detailed Scorecard is always loaded
Eureka Patch 4 Hot Fix 4

The Eureka Patch 4 Hotfix 4 release provides fixes for the Eureka release.

Category Problem Description
Chat PRB615103 Chat poller breaks if packet loss is sufficiently high. Users are unable to pull new messages and the conversation is disconnected.
Eureka Patch 4 Hotfix 2

The Eureka Patch 4 Hotfix 2 release provides fixes for the Eureka release.

Category Problem Description
Email PRB606365
KB0541175 		Parsing of email with Content-Type header should not be case-sensitive; this results in email with missing body content.
Eureka Patch 4 Hotfix 1

The Eureka Patch 4 Hotfix 1 release provides fixes for the Eureka release.

Category Problem Description
UI Policy PRB606698 Stored cross-site scripting in the Angular JS user interface.
Eureka Patch 4

The Eureka Patch 4 release provides fixes for the Eureka release.

Category Problem Description
Visual Task Boards PRB603721 The activity stream and VTB should honor element level read ACLs.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Log in to a Eureka instance as admin.
  2. Navigate to System Security > Access Control (ACL).
  3. Create a new access control with the following details:
    • Type: record
    • Operation: read
    • Name: Incident - Short Description
  4. Right-click the header and save.
  5. Click Edit on the Requires role related list.
  6. Add admin to the Requires role list and save.
  7. Log out and log back in as itil.
  8. Open the active incident list.
  9. Open the activity stream.
    Note that the short description is visible on each stream entry even though the expected result is that the short description should not be readable.
  10. Right-click any incident and add it to any Visual Task Board.
    Note that the short description is visible on the card title but the card title should not be the short description.
Asset Management PRB603982 The Enforce CI Verification setting for configuration items does not work when the model category gets changed on a model record that matches the CI's model category.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce

Without Discovery:

  1. Go to the cmdb_model_category table and find the record for Computer [cmdb_ci_computer].
    This record should have the asset class set to Hardware [alm_hardware].
  2. Open this record and set the Enforce CI verification field to true.
  3. Go to the cmdb_ci_computer table and create a new record with the following values:
    • Name: Any value (for example, Test Computer)
    • Model ID: Choose a model where the category is only "Computer" (for example, Asus G Series)
  4. Save the record.
    You should see in this record that there is no asset value.
  5. Go to the cmdb_hardware_product_model table and choose a model record that only has "Computer" for the model category. You can choose the same record as above or a different record.
    For this step and the previous step, make sure that the asset tracking strategy for the model record(s) you select is not set to "Don't create assets".
  6. Open this record.
  7. For the model categories, remove the "Computer" reference and save the record.
  8. Reopen this same record and add the "Computer" reference again.
  9. If you refresh the cmdb_ci_computer record, you should see that an asset record has now been created for this CI.

With Discovery:

  1. Prepare to scan a CI via Discovery for which you know the model and what class it will create.
    For example, if you scan an Apple computer, this will create a "cmdb_ci_computer" record with a model like "Apple MacBookPro10,1".
  2. Repeat steps 1-4 above but make sure the cmdb_model_category record where you enable the "Enforce CI verification" matches what will be created by the CI that you scan.
  3. Scan your CI.
  4. After scanning, check the following:
    • A new cmdb_hardware_product_model record should be created.
    • For the dummy CI you created, check to see if an asset record is now created for this CI.
Business Service Map PRB604014 BSM map crashes on rendering of certain CI's that have relationships with empty parents.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Create a relationship with an empty parent in the CMDB.
  2. Open the BSM map.
  3. Expand a node/CI that contains the CI with the empty parent.
  4. Witness the crash.
Business Service Map PRB605670 Ability to hide the glyph (plus sign) in BSM map.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Observe the out-of-box ACL on the cmdb_rel_ci table that restricts users below the ITIL user to create/write/delete.
  2. Enable the module View map for non-ITIL users by adding public in the security settings, making non-ITIL users able to view the map.
  3. Impersonate Joe Employee and open the BSM map.
  4. Observe that right-clicking on existing connection is disabled.
  5. Also observe that you can still create new connection(s) via the "+" glyph sign, thus bypassing the ACL.
Chat PRB603141 New chat messages are not read to users with screen readers.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Enable Chat.
  2. Go to /ess as Joe Employee using Internet Explorer with the Jaws screen reader or Firefox with the NVDA screen reader.
  3. Open Service Desk Chat.
  4. Type messages into the chat window.
    The messages you type and the messages you receive from the technician should be read through the screen reader.
CMDB PRB604976 Unable to add more than one affected CI at a time from BSM view.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Navigate to Incident > Create New.
  2. Create an incident and set the Configuration item field to CMS App FLX.
  3. Click Save.
  4. Open the BSM map by clicking the reference icon next to the field.
  5. Using shift + left mouse click, select the boxes MySQL FLX and Oracle FLX.
  6. Right-click and select Add Affected CI.
  7. Refresh the incident form.
    Notice that only two affected CIs exist in the related list.
Discovery PRB599712 Application mapping is not connecting IIS to the processes that communicate with it.
Discovery PRB600017 The fix script to migrate to the new VM schema now retains custom data and custom business rules against the cmdb_ci_vm_instance table. Fields in the cmdb_ci_vm_instance table that are not provided by default are now prefixed with u_ and the business rules are left inactive.
Import/Export PRB602805 After upgrading to Dublin, the onAfter transform script does not execute when the onBefore transform script has ignore = true.
Import/Export PRB605483 The transform history record is missing the Set and Import set table values when there are two or more transforms and the transform is done by processor ImportProcessor.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Create an Excel file with a couple of columns and rows.
  2. Create a data source.
    <file_retrieval_method>Attachment
    <format>Excel
    <type>File
  3. Create >=2 transform maps for it. They can be identical.
  4. Load the following URL, replacing the parameters shown in all caps.
    https://www.INSTANCENAME.service-now.com/sys_import.do?create_new_module=ON&sysparm_extends=sys_import_set_row&import_source=data_source&selected_application=import_sets&sysparm_data_source=SYS_ID_OF_DATASOURCE&sysparm_tablelabel=DATASOURCE_LABEL&sysparm_transform_after_load=true&sysparm_tablename=DATASOURCE_TABLENAME&sysparm_recreate_table=false
  5. Load the module Transform History.
    Of the most recent transforms, only one will contain the Set and Import set table values.
Notifications PRB603978 Line breaks in the body of an email client template are lost when the template populates the email client message text.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Create a client template.
  2. Set the table to Incident.
  3. Enter text into the body and be sure to enter a few new lines.
  4. Open up the email client on Incident.
    Notice that the line breaks are missing.
Notifications PRB604319 If you use email.setBody() in a mail script to set the email body, the body content appears twice in the resulting email. For instance, calling email.setBody('123') results in an email that contains the body text 123123.
Notifications PRB602481 The Conditions field on the Email Filter form is case sensitive. For example, if an email filter is set to ignore emails when the Condition field is set to [Keywords] [are] [Undeliverable], the filter will not ignore emails that contain the text undeliverable.
Notifications PRB598544 Emails with too many attachments or attachments that are too large cause performance issues or outages.

Notable Change: System properties are added to enable administrators to limit the maximum email attachment size and quantity.

Persistence PRB606129 Missing index on wf_context.parent_activity / wf_context.column_renderer.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Invoke an online alter that will add two reference fields to one table in a single online alter.
    This cannot be done interactively except by committing an update set.
  2. Observe that only one of the two necessary reference indexes is created.
Project Management PRB600098 The widget that displays project portfolio information on the Project Overview homepage does not filter correctly.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Open a Dublin instance.
  2. Ensure that Project Management v3 is active.
  3. Navigate to the Project Overview homepage.
  4. Look at the Project Portfolio: IT Projects and Project Portfolio: Business Projects lists.
    Note that these lists display all active records in pm_portfolio_project instead of the specific projects associated with each project portfolio.
Project Management PRB600378 The Project Overview page has broken gauges.
Project Management PRB602037 The system hangs if a large number of days is entered for a project's planned duration.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Navigate to Project > Projects > Create New.
  2. On the Project form, enter 7000 for the number of days in the Planned duration field.
  3. Click Submit.
    Note that the system hangs.
Project Management PRB602801 The Demand [dmn_demand] table and Requirement [dmn_requirement] table state choices are not created after activating the Demand Management application.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Activate the Project Management plugin.
  2. Activate the Demand Management plugin.
    Note that the choice list for State in the Task table has duplicate values for Incident and Problem.
Reporting PRB605523 Creating a Pivot Table report on the Incident table can result in an error.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Open a Eureka instance.
  2. Create a new incident.
  3. Personalize the Category field and add a new choice or change an existing choice value to "Intermittent outage".
  4. Create a new incident record with the newly created Category field choice.
  5. Create a new Pivot Table report.
  6. Adjust the report options as following:
    • Table = Incident
    • Column = Category
    • Aggregation = Average = Time worked or Business Duration
  7. Run the report and then check the error log.
Service Catalog PRB588534 Catalog items with a cart do not display correctly when within an order guide.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Open a demo instance.
  2. From the Service Catalog, add 10 or more items to the cart.
  3. Navigate to Service Catalog > Catalog Definition > Maintain Items.
  4. Open Sales Laptop.
  5. Personalize the form to add the Cart field and then save.
  6. Add the catalog_cart_default UI macro to this field and click Update.
  7. Click Try It.
    See that the cart is in a column on the right. The variables are immediately below the description. This is expected behavior.
  8. Navigate to Service Catalog > Catalog Definition > Order Guides.
  9. Open New Employee Hire.
  10. Click Try It.
  11. Enter the following information:
    • Employee's Name: any name
    • Employee's Title: any title
    • Employee's Department: Sales
  12. Click Choose Options.
    See that the cart is in a column within the same cell as the description. The variables are pushed way down the page after a large whitespace gap. This is not expected behavior.
Service Catalog PRB592446 The Continue Shopping button in the shopping cart redirects to an incorrect URL.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Log in to a Dublin instance.
  2. Set the glide.sc.continue.shopping.target system property to the following:
    catalog_home.do?sysparm_view=catalog_default
  3. Go to a CMS page (for example, https://demonightlydublin.service-now.com/ess/).
  4. In the Order Things column, click Computers.
  5. Click on any item and then click Add to Cart.
  6. Click Continue Shopping.
    The following error message is displayed:
    A view name can only contain A-Z, a-z, 0-9 and _.
Service Catalog PRB600132 After creating a variable that makes use of a reference qualifier and saving the form, the Reference qual field gets hidden.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Go to item_option_new.do.
  2. In the Type field, select Reference.
  3. Click the Question tab and enter values in the Question and Name fields.
  4. Click the Type Specification tab.
  5. Select a reference.
  6. Set the Use reference qualifier field to Advanced.
  7. Populate the Reference qual field and click Submit.
  8. Open the variable again.
    Note that the "Use reference qualifier" field is still set to Advanced but the Reference qual field is no longer displayed.
Service Catalog PRB603603 The Continue Shopping button in the CMS opens in frame and the UI has to break out.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Open an item or category in CMS.
  2. Click the Continue Shopping button.
    This temporarily opens the whole screen (left bar, title bar and content) inside the content frame. The frame buster code will kick in pretty quickly so that the screen is loaded in the whole browser.
    Sometimes this happens too quickly but sometimes you see a flash of that content. The button needs to target the browser, not the frame, when in CMS and also not when an external cart is used.
Service Catalog PRB603738 Catalog categories are no longer translated.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Go to a Eureka Patch 2 instance.
  2. Navigate to System Definition > Plugins.
  3. Activate one of the l18N language translations (for example, I18N: Japanese Translations)
  4. Change the instance language to Japanese using the system menu.
  5. Go to Self-Service > Service Catalog.
    Notice that some of the content, such as the category titles and even some of the catalog items, have not been translated to Japanese.
Service Catalog PRB604099 After upgrading to Eureka, an out of memory condition occurs when null or zero length strings are entered into the search field.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Go to Self-Service > Service Catalog.
  2. Click in the search field.
  3. Enter a space and click the search icon.
    The following message appears in the log:
    SEVERE *** ERROR *** OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space
Service Catalog PRB604290 The Catalog UI Policy Action for Read Only does not work as expected on multiple choice variables.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Log in to a Eureka instance.
  2. Navigate to Service Catalog > Maintain Items.
  3. Click on Access.
  4. Create a multiple choice variable and give it a name and question.
    Be sure to create at least two options for this variable.
  5. Save the variable.
  6. Create a catalog UI policy on this item.
  7. Create a catalog UI policy action on the new multiple choice variable.
  8. Set this UI policy action to Read only=true.
  9. Do not set a condition to ensure this runs.
  10. Save.
  11. Go to Access item and click Try it.
    Notice that the current option is read only but the other options are selectable.
Service Catalog PRB605426 In Internet Explorer 8, a long-running JavaScript error is caused by isRadioControl(fieldName) when a large number of radio button variables are used on a catalog item.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce

Place 100+ radio button variables on an item and open in Internet Explorer 8.

SLA PRB593926 The Default SLA Workflow can end before the third Create Event activity runs.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Open up the Priority 1 resolution (8 hour) SLA definition.
  2. Change the duration to 1 minute.
  3. Create a P1 incident by setting Impact and Urgency to High.
  4. After the SLA breaches, open up that task_sla record and view its workflow.
User Interface PRB601370 When using Internet Explorer, the UI14 interface does not work in Eureka when document mode/user agent string is less than 9 or compatibility view is enabled.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Using IE 9, IE 10 or IE 11, log into a Eureka instance.
  2. Open F12 Developer Tools and go to Emulation.
    The Document mode is set to 7 and so UI14 is not loaded. (If this is not set to 7 by default, UI14 will work normally. In that case, change document mode to 7 and log out. UI14 will not work properly after that.)
  3. Now in F12 Developer Tools > Emulation, change Document mode to 9 and User agent string to Internet Explorer 9.
  4. Log out and back in.
    This will fix the issue and UI14 will work properly.
User Interface PRB603313 When using UI14, the reference icon is missing from reference fields rendered as choice lists.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Log in as admin.
  2. Navigate to Self-Service > My Profile.
  3. Click the Notification Preferences related link.
  4. Select a record from the list.
    In Dublin, the Device field has a reference icon but in Eureka and beyond, the reference icon is missing. The reference icon appears when the UI14 plugin is turned off.
User Interface PRB603769 After upgrading to Eureka and the UI14 interface, the Application, Update Set and Theme pickers are not visible for admin users if they were previously hidden.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Go to /navpage.do?sysparm_device=browser.
  2. Click the toggle icon to the left of the Logout button to hide the selectors.
  3. Go to /navpage.do?sysparm_device=doctype.
  4. Click the white cog icon in upper right corner.
    Notice that the selectors are hidden.
User Interface PRB604942 Eureka Patch 3 does not work in Internet Explorer 8.
User Interface PRB604946 In Internet Explorer 8, list edit new row throws an error.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Navigate to an incident form.
  2. Right-click the form header and select Personalize > Form Layout.
  3. Add the embedded list Private Task > Incident and save.
  4. View the form.
User Interface PRB605263 Cannot access the context menu by right-clicking the form section headers.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Log in to a Eureka instance.
  2. Open an incident form.
  3. Scroll down and right-click on any of the form section headers.
    Notice that nothing happens.
Workflow PRB603522 In the workflow If activity for a requested item, using a variable in the condition builder results in an error.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Log in to a Eureka instance.
  2. Go to a workflow which is tied to a catalog item.
  3. In the workflow, add an If activity. In the condition builder, use the value Variables and use any type of variable.
    If you order the catalog item attached to this workflow, you will receive an error.
Workflow PRB604324 Setting the abort action on an approval business rule is not creating the new approval.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Create a catalog item with a workflow that has a group approval.
  2. Add some people in that group, including yourself.
  3. Write a business rule on sysapproval_approver to not create approval if it's yours by abort action.
    When: before
    Insert: checked
    Condition: current.sysapproval.sys_class_name == "sc_req_item"
    Script:
    if(current.sysapproval.opened_by == current.approver || current.sysapproval.request.requested_for == current.approver){
    current.setAbortAction(true);
    }
Workflow PRB604632 After upgrading to Eureka, "In flight" workflows with running subflows that get closed after the upgrade are not linking back to the main flow.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Open an instance running a version prior to Eureka.
  2. Create a workflow and a subflow that gets called by the workflow.
    In the subflow, make sure there is some type of "condition" activity where the subflow can be stopped.
  3. Depending on the table you link these mainflow and subflow records to, create two records that use this workflow/subflow.
    1. For the first record, go through the whole workflow process to call and run through the subflow and the mainflow. Both should be "Finished".
    2. For the second record, have the workflow call the subflow, but keep the subflow in a "executing" state.
  4. Upgrade your instance to Eureka.
    This is supposed to run an XML "fix_subflow_parent_activity"; however if you look at logs, you will likely see that this script throws an error and does not get run successfully.
  5. Go to the second record where the subflow is still running and complete the process to make the subflow finish.
    You should then expect that the mainflow will finish it's activity and proceed, but it appears that the mainflow will be stalled.
    In the subflow workflow logs, you will see this type of error:
    Subflow to parent flow signaling failed.
Eureka Patch 3 Hotfix 2

The Eureka Patch 3 Hotfix 2 release provides fixes for the Eureka release.

Category Problem Description
UI Policy PRB606698 Stored cross-site scripting in the Angular JS user interface.


Eureka Patch 3 Hotfix 1

The Eureka Patch 3 Hotfix 1 release provides fixes for the Eureka release.

Category Problem Description
Visual Task Boards PRB603824 Enforce ACLs when assigning members to tasks.
Visual Task Boards PRB603828 Need to enforce ACLs during lane changes on the VTB.
Visual Task Boards PRB604055 ACL enforcement in VTB not strict enough.
User Interface PRB604942 Eureka Patch 3 does not work in Internet Explorer 8.
Business Service Map PRB603564 Customers cannot hide out-of-box Relation actions and Menu actions in the Eureka BSM map.
Discovery PRB601103 When a no classify process handler is created, the ADM process will no longer create the pending process classifier that matches the same condition specified in the no classify process handler.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Point a Windows MID server to a Dublin instance.
  2. Enable glide.discovery.auto_adm and glide.discovery.adm.map_local_connection.
  3. Discover the MID server host.
    Note that a pending process classification like the following is created: "Pending: wrapper-windows-x86-64.exe..."
  4. Navigate to Discovery > CI Classifications > Pending Process > Pending.
    Note that wrapper-windows-x86-64.exe connecting & listening.
  5. Click on the related link Create No classify process handler > Yes.
  6. Delete the pending process classification so it also deletes the relationship to the host.
  7. Re-run the ADM probe.
    The pending process is recreated.
Email PRB603023 Domain separation stops the business rule Domain - Set Domain - Email from setting the user's domain.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Activate the Domain Separation plugin using "Domain Support - MSP Extensions Installer".
  2. Set Abel Tuter's domain to "MSP Technicians (Optional)".
  3. Set Abel Tuter's Email field to some address from which you can send email.
  4. Send an email to the instance.
    Observe that the target table for the email record is empty and that a log statement with source EMAIL.<sys_id of email you sent in> with the message "Unable to classify email" has been created.
Financial Management PRB603555 A very large amount of jobs caused excessive database contention.
Import/Export PRB597391 Change the default FTP connection to passive.

Notable change: The connection.passive setting changed from being "false" by default to "true". For more information, see FTP Extended Properties.

Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Set up an FTP connection.
  2. Set it to active.
    The connection fails and generates the following error:
    The Import log return the following "Warning" message :
    java.io.IOException: /glide/nodes/gfimspdev002_16016/bin/../tmp/gurlfa1a3a1c78b69500107e66c5bf3ae0aa.tmp size:0
Import/Export PRB603569 Transform maps update via Mapping Assist related link.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. When building a transform map in Eureka, click on the Mapping Assist related link.
  2. After modifying the map and saving it, specify coalesce field and update.
    This action always wipes out the 1 coalesce value from true to false. It also wipes out the Script field map value of Use source script (true to false) as well as the source script itself (blanks it out).
Import/Export PRB601342 Importing date/time data into Planned start and Planned end fields in the change_request table shows the wrong time unless the user's timezone is set to US/Pacific.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. On a Dublin instance, load the following user (Admin2): Admin2_sys_user_192d672d6f7021008ba142dbea3ee48e.xml.
    The user's timezone is set to London.
  2. Add the admin role to the Admin2 user.
  3. Load the following (thumann_ds) datasource: datasource_sys_data_source_9c0e276d6f7021008ba142dbea3ee426.xml.
  4. The datasource contains the .xls attachment.
  5. Load the associated (thumann_tr) transform map: transform_sys_transform_map_d59e2f6d6f7021008ba142dbea3ee477.xml.
  6. Load the transform map field entries: tr_entries_sys_transform_entry.
  7. Navigate to the thumann_ds data source.
  8. Run a test toad of 20 records to create the file.
  9. Run the transform on the ISET number you just loaded.
    This should insert one record.
  10. Check the change record just added and note that the Planned start and Planned end fields are 8 hours in the future.
Import/Export PRB602201 LDAP via MID-Paging enabled on LDAP server but instance does not page result set. MID is paging unaware.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. AD has paging enabled (often the case).
  2. Glide property glide.ldap.paging has been added to the instance and to the MID server configuration parameters (ecc_agent_config).
    This is a Glide property, so its application to the MID server configuration requires clarification.
  3. "Nibbling" is observed rather than paging in the instance logs.
    The MID server does not seem to be paging aware.
Incident Management PRB602983 The Incident Management (com.snc.incident) plugin in the Dublin upgrade changes the value of the glide.ui.autoclose.time property to 0.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce

Upgrade a Calgary instance to Dublin.

The Best Practice-Incident Resolution Workflow (com.snc.bestpractice.incident) plugin in the Dublin upgrade sets the value of the glide.ui.autoclose.time property to 1.

Then the Incident Management (com.snc.incident) plugin in the Dublin upgrade sets the value of the glide.ui.autoclose.time property to 0.

Mobile Browser PRB593286 Field dependency does not work correctly when viewing an incident form on the mobile browser.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. From the desktop UI, navigate to any form that has a standard dependent choice list.
  2. Create a new incident.
  3. Set the Category to Request.
    Notice that the Subcategory field displays three options.
  4. Set the Category to Software.
    Notice that the Subcategory field displays two options.
  5. Switch to the mobile UI (/$m.do) and repeat steps 1-4.
    Notice the number of options in the Subcategory field.
Mobile Browser PRB598431 Searching on the mobile UI bypasses the reference qualifier settings.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Change the reference qualifier on a reference field to limit the results in some way. For example, Name starts with "A"
  2. In a desktop browser:
    1. Click the search icon (magnifying glass) on the form where the field appears.
    2. Try searching for a result that should be filtered out by the reference qualifier.
      Note that you are not able to find these results.
  3. In the mobile UI:
    1. Click on the same reference field as in the step above.
      Notice that the default list is properly limited by the reference qualifier.
    2. Search for a result that should be filtered out by the reference qualifier and then delete the search.
      Note that all results are shown, ignoring the reference qualifier.
Mobile Browser PRB602364 Reference variables are not working correctly while using the mobile UI.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Create a catalog clients script like the following:
    function onLoad() {
    var gr = new GlideRecord('sys_user');
    gr.addQuery('sys_id', g_user.userID);
    gr.query(function(gr) {
    gr.next();
    g_form.setValue('name', gr.name); //not working : not displaying name in mobile UI
    });
    The expected result: It should display the name in both desktop and mobile UI.
    The actual result: g_form.setValue('name', gr.sys_id, gr.name); is not working in mobile UI.
Persistence PRB594453 Adding multiple fields to a table performs n individual alters, one for each field.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Enable sql debugging and/or tracing.
  2. Navigate to System Definition > Tables and click New.
  3. Enter the following inputs:
    • Name: taskchild1
    • Extends table: Task
  4. Add multiple fields before submitting the new table.
  5. Insert multiple rows in the Columns embedded list:
    • c1 string
    • c2 string
    • c3 string
  6. Submit the new table.
  7. Verify the SQL generated includes multiple ALTER TABLE commands, one per table.
Platform Miscellaneous PRB603001 Bitmap (.bmp) images do not work in Eureka.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Open a Eureka instance.
  2. Navigate to Images > New.
  3. Upload the attached .bmp file and click Save.
  4. Now try to view the file by clicking on <img src=""whateveryouenamedthefile.bmpx" width="333" height="319"/>.
    Note that the file is not found.
Platform Miscellaneous PRB603028 Uploading ZIP images with capital letter file extension results in broken images.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Open a Eureka instance.
  2. Navigate to System UI > Image ZIP Upload and upload a file with images containing an extension with capital letters such as .JPG.
  3. Go to System UI > Images and check the image name.
    The name should display as <name>.JPG. However, if you try to upload an image with extension .JPG when using System UI > Images, that is not possible and a popup shows the following message: Image names must end with .gif, .png, .jpg, .ico or .bmp.
    Also we can image the extension to capital letters via list accessing System UI > Images and editing the name.
  4. Go to Service Catalog and click the Edit icon for Hardware.
  5. Open Sales Laptop abd try to add an image with capital letters which was created using image ZIP upload.
    Note that the image does not display.
Platform Miscellaneous PRB603760 Transaction Quota Manager fails to kill a transaction that causes nodes to run out of semaphores.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Generate a large amount of users (i.e., 800,000).
  2. Go to the Users by Location report.
  3. Change Group by from "location" to "user_name".
    This forces the reporting engine to iterate through a large amount of groups.
  4. Run the report.
    This will take a long time. When the cancel prompt is displayed, click Cancel.
    You can see that the cancel was not able to stop iterating through every group.
Platform Reliability PRB602237 The instance becomes unstable after attempting to activate the com.glideapp.workflow plugin.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. From your Dublin branch, import the attached plugin.xml into your glide/glide/plugsin/com.snc.core/plugin.xml file.
    This plugin.xml has many of the "boot" related plugins commented out to match the environment from the customers.
  2. zBoot your Dublin branch.
  3. Bring up your instance and navigate to Plugins.
  4. Place breakpoints at the offending lines above (at com.glide.script.GlideRecord.addQuery(GlideRecord.java:2164)).
  5. Activate the com.glideapp.workflow plugin.
    Note that halfway through the plugin activation, the NullPointerException will be thrown.
Service Catalog PRB592578 When using the Hebrew language plugin and submitting a request, the user receives a com.glideapp.servicecatalog_checkout_view UI page with the content aligned to the left instead of the right.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Open a Dublin instance.
  2. Enable the Hebrew language plugin.
  3. Use the language picker to set the language to Hebrew.
  4. Navigate to Service Catalog > Office.
  5. Click on Package and Ship Inter-office or to external addresses.
  6. Fill out the details and submit the request.
    Note that the columns and buttons on the checkout screen are aligned to the left.
  7. Open a new browser tab and a new Dublin instance.
  8. Change the language to English and repeat the steps 4-5.
    Note that the columns and buttons on the checkout screen are aligned correctly.
Service Catalog PRB600746 Stacktrace is shown when creating a Category Request.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Ensure that the Service Creator plugin is not installed (for Eureka and Fuji).
  2. Go to Self-Service > Service Catalog > Can We Help You?
  3. Open an Item Designer Category Request.
  4. Populate the fields and submit.
  5. Look at the system console where a stacktrace is shown.
Service Catalog PRB602971 Creating a catalog item with a select box with Include none checked and a choice table and choice field that also contains --None-- makes the system show two lines --None-- in Dublin.
Service Catalog PRB603187 Submitting a request through the mobile UI does not submit the last field on a form.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Create a record producer for incident with two variables.
  2. Open the record producer in the mobile UI.
  3. Give each variable a value and then submit.
  4. Open the incident form in the desktop UI and add the variable editor.
  5. Note that the variables are empty or missing.
Service Catalog PRB603366 During upgrades, the new Order field on io_set_item sets the default value for existing records, which causes variable layout issues.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Open a pre-Eureka instance that has variable sets defined for some items.
  2. Upgrade to Eureka Patch 1 or Patch 2.
    Note that the records in the io_set_item field are set to 100 when the values should be empty.
Service Catalog PRB603603 The Continue Shopping button in the CMS opens in frame and the UI has to break out.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Open an item or category in CMS.
  2. Click the Continue Shopping button.
    This temporarily opens the whole screen (left bar, title bar and content) inside the content frame. The frame buster code will kick in pretty quickly so that the screen is loaded in the whole browser.
    Sometimes this happens too quickly but sometimes you see a flash of that content. The button needs to target the browser, not the frame, when in CMS and also not when an external cart is used.
Service Level Agreements PRB593692 When an SLA reset condition is true and a new task_sla record is created, the SLA pause condition is not correctly evaluated.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Go to the out-of-box Priority 1 Resolution (8 hour) SLA Definition (contract_sla record).
  2. Click Personalize > Form Layout and add the Reset Condition to the form.
  3. Add the following Reset Condition to the SLA definition and then save it.
    • Updates greater than 0
    • Incident state is New or Active
  4. Navigate to Incident > Create New.
  5. Open a new incident, set the Impact, Urgency and Priority fields to 1-High, and click Save.
    As a result, a task_sla record is created with a status of In Progress.
  6. Add a comment and click Save.
    The existing task_sla record changes to Completed and a new In Progress task_sla record is created.
  7. Change the incident's State field to Awaiting problem and click Save.
    The In Progress task_sla record is Paused.
  8. Add a comment and click Save.
    The task_sla record is still Paused.
  9. Change the incident's State to New and click Save.
    The task_sla record is marked as complete; a new task_sla record is created but is Paused and not In Progress even though the pause condition is no longer true.
Service Level Agreements PRB603681 There are two issues that cause an incorrect calculation of retroactive pause time for a Task SLA record.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce

Issue 1

  1. Create an SLA definition record with the following values:
    • Name: SLA Test 1
    • Duration: 1 hour
    • Retroactive start: true
    • Set start to: Created
    • Start condition: "Active is true" and "Priority is 3 - Moderate"
    • Stop condition: "Active is false"
    • Pause condition: "State is Awaiting Problem"
  2. Create a second SLA definition record with the following values:
    • Name: SLA Test 2
    • Duration: 1 hour
    • Retroactive start: true
    • Set start to: Created
    • Start condition: "Active is true" and "Priority is 2 - High"
    • Stop condition: "Active is false"
    • Pause condition: "State is Awaiting Problem"
  3. Create an incident with a priority of "3 - Moderate" and a state of "Awaiting Problem".
  4. Confirm that the incident gets a new Task SLA record attached for "SLA Test 1" and the stage is "Paused".
  5. Wait a few minutes and then update the incident's state to "In Progress" and confirm that the Task SLA record for "SLA Test 1" changes to have a stage of "In progress".
  6. Update the incident to have a priority of "2 - High" and confirm that the Task SLA record for "SLA Test 1" is now cancelled and a new Task SLA record has been attached for "SLA Test 2".
  7. Add the columns Pause duration and Planned end time to the related list for Task SLAs on the incident.
    You will see that "SLA Test 1" has the few minutes of pause time in the Pause duration field which has been added to the "Planned end time" (this is correct). The Task SLA for "SLA Test 1" has an empty pause duration and planned end time is still exactly 1 hour after the start time (this is incorrect).

Issue 2

  1. Create an SLA definition record with values:
    • Name: SLA Test
    • Duration: 1 hour
    • Retroactive start: true
    • Set start to: Created
    • Start condition: "Active is true" and "Priority is 3 - Moderate"
    • Stop condition: "Active is false"
    • Pause condition: "Short description contains SLA Test"
  2. Create a new incident with priority 4 and short description set to "SLA Test".
  3. Confirm that a Task SLA for "SLA Test" is not attached to the incident after creating it.
  4. Wait a minute and then update the Incident to be priority 3.
  5. Confirm that a Task SLA for "SLA Test" SLA is now attached.
  6. Add the Pause time column to the Task SLA related list.
    This shows the current date/time instead of the date/time that the short description was set to "SLA test".
Software Asset Management PRB603242 The nightly counter deletes counter details with no license.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Delete all licenses from a software model.
  2. Run a counter for a software model.
    Notice the results and that the counter is cached.
  3. Run the counter (now cached) again.
    Notice that the counter details are deleted and then reinserted before the count is updated.
Text Search PRB603458 A NumberFormatException is thrown when a text search query causes a document score to exceed Integer.MAX_VALUE.
UI Policy PRB602990 UI Policy conditions use sys id in the mobile UI instead of the display value.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Open to a Dublin instance.
  2. Import the attached UI policy MobileSysidbug.
  3. Navigate to Incident and open any incident, remembering the incident number.
  4. Change the caller to any caller beginning with ACME and save the form.
    Note that the alert pops up true.
  5. Change the caller to any caller beginning with anything other than ACME.
    Note that the alert pops up false.
  6. Go to the mobile view ($m.do).
  7. Navigate to Incident and open the same incident used in step 3.
    Make sure the caller starts with ACME.
  8. Note that the pop up is false when it should be true.
Update Sets PRB602948 Update set commit for new table create calls Bootstrap() which starts a transaction and can hang a long-running alter on locks.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Create an update set that creates a new child table from the Task table.
  2. Commit the update set.
  3. Try updating tasks or incidents during the update set commit.
    If you use a large enough instance, you should see the updates fail with errors in the UI.
User Interface PRB585451 New sys_ui_list created for task in portal view on homepage.
Visual Task Boards PRB600587 Visual Task Board (VTB) cards should not be visible when records are restricted by ACLs.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Install the Work Management plugin.
  2. Go to the Visual Task Boards.
  3. Click Boards.
  4. Click New.
  5. Give the task board a name.
  6. Fill in the following fields:
    • Task Table: Work Order Task [wm_task]
    • Lane field: State
  7. Filter for the following criteria:
    • State is pending dispatch
  8. Add the following board members: Abel Tuter, Claudio Loose
  9. Impersonate Abel Tuter.
  10. Type wm_task.list in the Application Navigator filter.
    Note that Abel Tuter cannot access the records due to a security constraint.
  11. Now access My Task Boards.
    Note that cards are displayed for those records.
Visual Task Boards PRB601889 Visual task boards do not work properly if the Mobile UI plugin is not enabled.
User Interface PRB602550 Form annotations (section separator annotations) do not follow all overall themes in Eureka.
User Interface PRB602920 Navigator separators are not bold in Windows Chrome 32+ for UI14.
User Interface PRB603077 System log error: CSS Property file not found: styles_light_blue.properties: no thrown error due to theme.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Open a Eureka instance.
  2. Set glide.ui.css.name to styles_light_blue.
  3. Reload navpage.do.
User Interface PRB603089 In Business Edition, tagged documents cannot be removed.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Login as admin.
  2. Navigate to a list, right-click on a record and select Assign Tag.
    Create a new tag or use any current tag.
  3. Navigate to Tagged Documents and select the tag where the record was assigned.
  4. On the record, hover over the small (X) on upper right hand corner.
    Notice it says Remove Tag.
  5. Click the x.
    Notice that nothing happens. The record is still there. The tag only gets removed once the record is selected and Remove Tag is selected from the right-click menu.
User Interface PRB603092 The tablet interface does not display formatting or bullets in KB articles.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Open a Dublin instance on a tablet.
  2. Go to the Knowledge Base and look for any article that is formatted with bullets, numbers, and tables (e.g., KB0000024).
  3. Open the article.
    Note that it is stripped of all formatting and appears as plain text.
Visual Task Boards PRB603116 Tagged documents in Eureka UI14 do not obey ACL restrictions.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce

Scenario 1

  1. Create a new table and make it available to ITIL User (can make it public role in table creator).
  2. Go to the table and create two test records and view them as ITIL User.
  3. Verify that the two records appear in the Tabbed Documents page.
  4. Add two fields to the table.
  5. Create the following ACLs:
    • table - (row-level) - public (already created if you used the table creator and made the table with role=public)
    • table.* - (field-level) - script: false;
  6. Click the Tagged Documents button on the Edge to display the Tagged Documents page.
    The cards should appear because the user can read the record, but the two fields should not appear.
    Note: If you are not sure that you created the ACLs correctly in step 5, you can go to incident_list.do and you will see the column names but no data for those columns for any record.

Scenario 2

  1. As ITIL User, view a couple of incidents and verify that they appear on the Tagged Documents page.
  2. Create the following ACL:
    • incident.short_description - role: admin
  3. Verify that ITIL User cannot see that column any longer on incident_list.do.
  4. Click the Tagged Documents button on the Edge to display the Tagged Documents page.
  5. The ITIL User should not see the short description right below the card title.
Visual Task Boards PRB603271 Column header filters add an extra blank filter by default.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Open a Eureka instance.
  2. Navigate to Incidents > Open.
  3. Click the search icon (magnifying glass) on the list header to enable the column search fields.
  4. Type "active" in the search field under Incident State and "software" under Assignment Group.
  5. Open the breadcrumb to see how the filtering was done.
    Note that there is an empty filter.
User Interface PRB603554 The UI11 Application Navigator search field does not search based on separator text.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Open a Eureka Patch 1 instance with UI14.
  2. Type "Server" in the Application Navigator filter.
    Under the Configuration application, you will see separators for Application Servers, Servers, and Database Servers, and you will see all of the modules listed under these separators.
  3. Set the glide.ui.doctype property to false to disable UI14.
  4. Log out and log back in.
  5. Type "Server" in the Application Navigator filter in UI11.
    Under the Configuration application, you will see separators for Application Servers, Servers, and Database Servers, but only the modules listed under these separators that contain the word "server" will display.
User Interface PRB603617 After testing the Eureka upgrade, the real-time activity stream opens to a "Page Not Found" error.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Zboot a Calgary instance.
  2. Check out and load Eureka Patch 2 on top of the same database.
  3. Go to scripts - background and run upgrade.js.
  4. When the upgrade is finished, restart the instance.
  5. Go to an incident list and open the activity stream.
    Note that the 404 error is displayed.
User Interface PRB603707 TinyMCE is not installed with upgrades to Eureka.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Install an instance without the TinyMCE HTML Editor plugin activated.
  2. Install Eureka and UI14.
  3. Navigate to Knowledge Base > Create New.
    Note that you get an alert and a plain text HTML field.
Workflow PRB602497 Request (sc_request) takes a long time to load due to a large number of sys_user queries in the database.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Have a lot of sysapproval_approvers with the state of Requested.
  2. Make sure a workflow will attach when sc_request is created.
  3. Navigate to sc_request.do.
  4. Save the record and make sure the workflow is attached.
    Note that it takes a long time to complete the insert.
Workflow PRB603875 Error message appearing in workflow following upgrade to Dublin Patch 2:

Cannot determine approval state :null

Work Management PRB599401 When an agent is assigned more than 10 tasks in a day, there is no image to represent the individual tasks beyond number 10.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Create more than 10 tasks and assign them to the same agent to the same day.
  2. Impersonate the user and open the side window to all tasks.


Eureka Patch 2 Hot Fix 2

The Eureka Patch 2 Hotfix 2 release provides fixes for the Eureka release.

Category Problem Description
UI Policy PRB600633 Uncaught ReferenceError: g_scratchpad is not defined
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Create the following display business rules for the Incident table:
    g_scratchpad.someName = [ ];
    g_scratchpad.someName.push(current);
  2. Load an Incident form.
    Note the JavaScript error in the browser console:
    Uncaught ReferenceError: g_scratchpad is not defined


Eureka Patch 2 Hotfix 1

The Eureka Patch 2 Hotfix 1 release provides fixes for the Eureka release.

Category Problem Description
Platform PRB603346 For upgraded Business Edition instances (Dublin to Eureka Patch 2), activating the Okta plugin causes the Business Rule and UI Policy forms to have scripting.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Upgrade a Business Edition instance from Dublin to Eureka Patch 2.
  2. Activate the Okta plugin.
  3. Go to the Business Rules form and the UI Policy form.
    Both forms include scripting and the Business Rule form displays the extra fields: Client callable, Delete & Query check boxes.
Platform Reliability PRB603626 When upgrading a Business Edition instance from Dublin to Eureka, the Business Rule form does not get assigned the correct roles.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Go to a Business Edition Dublin instance and upgrade to Eureka.
  2. Navigate to Dictionary > sys_script > Script (column name).
  3. Note that the Read role is empty and other roles may also be empty as well (all roles should be set to 'maint').


Eureka Patch 2

The Eureka Patch 2 release provides fixes for the Eureka release.

Category Problem Description
Apps - ITIL PRB602352 Timeline Visualization displays an error if the instance does not have High Security Settings enabled.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Log in to an instance that does not have the High Security Settings plugin enabled.
    Alternately, set the glide.ui.escape_text system property to false.
  2. Navigate to Timeline Visualization > All.
  3. Click CIO Roadmap or any other timeline record.
  4. Click the View button.
    The following message is displayed:
    The element type "canvas" must be terminated by the matching end-tag.
  5. Set the glide.ui.escape_text system property to true.
    The timeline works as expected.
Discovery PRB601755 Remote MIB files with extensions should not be allowed.
Discovery PRB601555 J2ssh takes the mid.ssh.use_keyboard_interactive as a switch between password and kbi rather than a priority selector. This causes problems where a customer needs both to be present.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Set mid.ssh.use_keyboard_interactive = true for a mid server.
  2. Connect to a machine that supports password but not kbi.
    This should try kbi, fail, and then connect with password. Instead, it tries kbi and then gives up.
Mobile Browser PRB599318 Live Feed is not available on the Dublin smartphone interface prior to Dublin Patch 3.
Mobile Browser PRB600272 If you change the glide.sys.date_format property to a representation like dd/MM/yyyy, it causes the time to reset to 00:00:00 (12:00 AM on iOS) when updating a date/time field.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Log in to a Dublin instance from a desktop browser.
  2. Modify the glide.sys.date_format system property. For example, set it to dd/MM/yyyy.
  3. Log in to a Dublin instance from the iOS Simulator or iPhone.
  4. Navigate to the change request list.
  5. Open any change request where the Planned start time field is populated.
  6. Modify the time value in the Planned start time field and save the record.
    The field should be updated with the entered value but the time value is reset to 12:00 AM. If viewed from the desktop browser, the displayed time value is 00:00:00.
Mobile Browser PRB601042 Variables show value instead of text for choice fields.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Go to the mobile UI.
  2. Navigate to Service Catalog > Hardware.
  3. Open the Apple iPhone 5.
  4. Look at the Contract duration field.
    The field shows twelve_months instead of 12 Months.
Platform as a Service PRB600081 Upgrading to Dublin breaks the Move to Application option when the glide.ui.escape_text system property is set to false.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Ensure that the glide.ui.escape_text system property is set to false.
    • On newer instances, this property is set to true by default.
    • On older instances, this property is set to false but is not visible in the sys_properties.list and must be added manually.
  2. If using an out-of-box Dublin Patch 1 instance, navigate to sys_properties.list and set the glide.ui.espace_text system property to false.
  3. Navigate to sys_ui_section.list and enter any form section record.
  4. Right-click on the header and select Move to Application.
    Note that the following error is displayed:
    The entity name must immediately follow the '&' in the entity reference.
Procurement PRB599639 If multiple model categories are associated with a model, procurement can create the asset, but not the associated CI.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Install the Procurement plugin.
  2. Navigate to Product Catalog > Product Model > Hardware Models.
  3. Click on MacBook Air 13.
  4. Add another category In the Model categories field.
  5. Create a purchase order for one of these product models.
    1. Navigate to Procurement > Orders > Purchase Orders and click New.
    2. Fill in the Ship to field with any selection and click Submit.
  6. Open the purchase order.
  7. In the Purchase order line items related list, click New and add the following information:
    • Vendor: Apple
    • Product Model: MacBook Air 13
  8. Click the Submit button for the line item.
  9. Click the Order button on the purchase order.
  10. Receive the order to create the asset.
    1. Click the Receive button.
    2. Select the Allow Asset Tag Input check box.
    3. Leave the Asset tag field blank.
    4. Fill in the S/N with any number.
    5. Click OK.
  11. Open the asset record for this asset.
    Note that the Configuration Item field is blank.
Reporting PRB600802 Percentages are missing in the Dublin release.
Reporting PRB601233 Reports do not open in the form pane tab when the main content pain is split into list and form views.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Click the List and Form View button in the Edge to split the main content frame.
  2. Navigate to Reports > View/Run.
    The report homepage (report_home.do) loads in the left frame.
  3. Click on any report.
    The report should load in the right frame, replacing the current content, but it does not load.
Security PRB601904 Create a business rule that prevents logged in users from locking themselves out.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Log in as admin.
  2. Navigate to System Defininition > Scripts - Background.
  3. Run the following script:
    var gr = new GlideRecord('sys_user');
    gr.query();
    while (gr.next()) {
    gr. locked_out = true;
    gr.update();
    }
Service Catalog PRB594805 Using g_form.setReadonly on a slush bucket/list collector in an onLoad catalog client script causes a JavaScript exception.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Open a Dublin instance.
  2. Edit the Apple iPhone 5 item.
  3. Add a new variable:
    • Type: List Collector
    • Table: sys_user
    • Name: users
  4. Create an onLoad client script with the following script:
    <tt>function onLoad() {
    g_form.setReadOnly("variables.users", true);
    }
  5. Preview the item.
    The slushbucket is not read-only and there is an error in the JavaScript console.
Service Catalog PRB601311 On the ESS Portal, the Add to Cart and Order Now buttons in the CMS Catalog Cart content block do not work.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Navigate to Content Management > Sites > Employee Self-Service.
  2. Enable the Use external cart check box and save the change.
  3. In the Pages related list, open Portal - Order Hardware.
  4. Click the Edit Page related link.
  5. Click Add content.
  6. Click Content Blocks, then Catalog Cart.
  7. Click the middle left Add here drop zone as the location for the content.
  8. Go to the /ess page.
  9. Click on Hardware and then Sales Laptop.
  10. Enable JavaScript debug in the browser.
  11. Click either the Add to Cart or Order Now button.
    Note the following error:
    Uncaught ReferenceError: alertPriceUpdate is not defined
Service Catalog PRB601359 When an item that has the No cart field checked is included in an order guide, part of the cart still shows up when the item is ordered.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Navigate to Service Catalog > Order Guides.
  2. Open the New Employee Hire order guide.
  3. Add the No cart check box to the form.
  4. Select the No cart check box and save the form.
  5. Click Try It.
  6. Fill out the form and select an iPhone 4.
  7. Click Choose Options.
    Note that This Item is still showing in upper right corner when there should be no cart.
Text Search PRB598817 Invalidating the glide.ts database pool will cause NullPointerExceptions (search fails on node).
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Start an instance and make sure the glide.ts pool has been initialized (run a text search).
  2. Run the dump_properties.js script in Scripts - Background.
  3. Run a text search.
    Notice NullPoint Exceptions in the logs, and that stats.do will not show an active glide.ts connection pool.
Update Sets PRB601748 Replace on Upgrade does not work for the sc_cat_item table.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Open a Calgary Patch 4 instance.
  2. Navigate to sc_cat_item.list.
  3. Open the Custom Business Cards record and make the record inactive by clearing the Active check box.
  4. Navigate to sys_update_xml.list.
    Note that Replace on Upgrade is set to false for the Custom Business Card record capture when it should be set to true.
Update Sets PRB602498 sys_ui_element and sys_ui_list_element are polluting the Update Version and Customer Updates tables.
Update Sets PRB602948 Update set commit for new table create calls Bootstrap() which starts a transaction and can hang a long-running alter on locks.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Create an update set that creates a new child table from the Task table.
  2. Commit the update set.
  3. Try updating tasks or incidents during the update set commit.
    If you use a large enough instance, you should see the updates fail with errors in the UI.
User Interface PRB576111 The OnChange script does not fire on document ID fields.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Create a document ID field.
  2. Create a client script which triggers when the document ID field is changed.
  3. In form view, select the reference lookup icon for the document ID field.
  4. Select an item from the reference dialog box and then click OK.
    Note that a change is not registered.
User Interface PRB576919 The start_locked=false attribute is not working and causes a bug because of the extra space.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Ensure that the Watch list field is on the form.
  2. Customize the dictionary attributes to include start_locked=true.
  3. Reload the form.
    Notice that that the watch list is still closed by default.
User Interface PRB588870 When using Internet Explorer 8 or 9, the UI11 interface does not redraw correctly after maximizing the browser window.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Open a Berlin Patch 9 instance in IE9.
  2. Click the Switch to the new UI link.
  3. If the browser window is maximized, reduce the size.
  4. Go to a different URL, for example www.google.com.
  5. Return to the instance and quickly maximize the browser window before the page finishes loading.
    Note that the user interface does not load in the fully maximized view and leaves blank space on the right. The user must refresh the page or click the Switch to the old UI link to maximize the user interface.
User Interface PRB597438 Mobile lists on the Task table do not open forms on the child table.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Install the new Mobile UI plugin.
  2. Navigate to System Mobile UI > Navigator Apps.
  3. Open any application menu.
  4. Create a new module using the Modules related list.
  5. Name the module and set the Table to Task [task].
  6. Navigate to /$m.do and to the module you just created.
  7. Open any record that is a child of the Task table.
    Notice that it comes up as a task and not as the child record.
User Interface PRB599732 The Live Feed content block on a homepage causes a bad redirect after updating a record opened from the homepage.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Open a Dublin instance and impersonate the ITIL User.
  2. Personalize the homepage by clicking the Add Content link.
  3. Scroll down the list of content blocks and click Live Feed.
  4. Select the Live Feed item from the right-hand list and add it to any drop zone.
  5. Return to the homepage and open any record in the My Work or My Groups Work list.
    If those lists are empty, add a gauge containing a list of task records to the homepage.
  6. Make any change to the record and then update. You can also save the record and then click the Back button.
    Note that you are returned to the Live Feed page in the main content window instead of your selected homepage.
User Interface PRB599774 Setting the Tablet UI property glide.ui.tablet_enabled to false does not inhibit the tablet view as it should.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Log in to a Dublin instance.
  2. Navigate to System Properties > Tablet UI Properties.
  3. Locate the Enable tablet UI property (glide.ui.tablet_enabled) and clear the checkmark, setting the property to No (false).
  4. Flush the instance cache.
    Note that the tablet access is still available by navigating /$tablet.do or /$tab_switch.do.
User Interface PRB601177 CMS pages were displayed in UI11, not UI14.
Workflow PRB601828 Sending an event to a completed workflow causes a memory leak in the workflow engine.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Execute the following script in Scripts – Background:
    new Workflow().broadcastEvent('<sys_id of a completed context here>', 'some_event');
  2. Note that the workflow engine just leaked a CommandQueue. To observe this, you must either:
    • Repeat multiple times and watch memory being consumed, or
    • Add logging (or breakpoints) to CommandManager.CommandQueue where we store a reference to CommandQueue in killSwitch and where we remove it.
    When you instrument CommandManager.CommandQueue and run this test, you will see that we save CommandQueue but never release it.
User Interface PRB601697 UI14 is not activated by default for upgraded instances.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Open a Eureka instance.
  2. Navigate to the ESS CMS: <instance name>/ess.
  3. Select Get Help > Get Help Status.
  4. Remove filters if necesary to show results.
    Note that the form is not displaying with the new UI.
Workflow PRB602157 Approval Coordinator is not working in Dublin Patch 2.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Create a new workflow on the Change Request table.
  2. Create an Approval Coordinator activity.
  3. Add one Group Approval and three Approval users.
  4. Create a change.
    Note that the Approval Coordinator is failing to create all the approvals.
Performance Analytics PRB601665 Time chart widgets with additional indicators and a 2nd Y axis still show series data on the first Y axis.
Eureka Patch 1 Hot Fix 6

The Eureka Patch 1 Hotfix 6 release provides fixes for the Eureka release. For more information about how to upgrade your instance, see Requesting an Upgrade.

For the Eureka Patch 1 Hotfix 6 release:

Build date: 11-21-2014_1126
Build tag: glide-eureka-04-08-2014__patch1-hotfix5-11-14-2014
 Note: To check the version on your instance, see Checking Your Release Version.


29 Fixed in This Release

Category Problem Description
Persistence PRB609448 For query optimization, Order by on a logical child table can be ignored to improve performance.
Persistence PRB612491 MySQL query optimizer chooses less performant indexes and can randomly change query plans as data volume grows.
Persistence PRB615782 Burst worker job behaves unexpectedly and prevents higher-priority jobs from running on that burst worker.


Eureka Patch 1 Hot Fix 4

The Eureka Patch 1 Hotfix 4 release provides fixes for the Eureka release.

Category Problem Description
Performance PRB609063 Certain queries in MySQL use an inefficient index and are consequently slow.
Eureka Patch 1 Hotfix 2

The Eureka Patch 1 Hotfix 2 release provides fixes for the Eureka release.

Category Problem Description
Workflow PRB601828 Sending an event to a completed workflow causes a memory leak in the workflow engine.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Execute the following script in Scripts – Background:
    new Workflow().broadcastEvent('<sys_id of a completed context here>', 'some_event');
  2. Note that the workflow engine just leaked a CommandQueue. To observe this, you must either:
    • Repeat multiple times and watch memory being consumed, or
    • Add logging (or breakpoints) to CommandManager.CommandQueue where we store a reference to CommandQueue in killSwitch and where we remove it.
    When you instrument CommandManager.CommandQueue and run this test, you will see that we save CommandQueue but never release it.


Eureka Patch 1

The Eureka Patch 1 release provides fixes for the Eureka release.

Category Problem Description
Authentication PRB577496 SSO authentication is required to access public pages if navigating with nav_to.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Make Survey public on instance with no SSO enabled.
  2. Confirm that pages can be accessed with and without nav_to.do?uri=.
  3. Enable SAML.
  4. Attempt to navigate to link with nav_to.do?uri=.
Authentication PRB594205 OpenID redirection does not preserve the original target URI properly.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Enable OpenID plugin and enable the installation exit script.
  2. Clear out all cookies (or open a new incognito window in Chrome).
  3. Click a nav_to link.
  4. Sign on with a valid account to pass OpenID authentication.
  5. Trace the network calls and you will notice that /navigator.do is redirecting the session.
  6. Click the same link again and it should open the sys id record because session already has a valid OpenID cookie.
Authentication PRB599622 After upgrading to Dublin Patch 1, customers using SAML may have users who are not able to log in and are continuously returned to their SAML page. This occurs for users who have a space or special characters in their username.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Upgrade to Dublin Patch 1.
  2. Log in as a user with a space or special characters in your username.
    Note that, upon submission, you are returned to the login page in a loop that prevents you from entering anything else.
Business Service Management PRB600037 The wrong label is displayed when visualizing a configuration item (CI) with an empty Name field.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Create a CI with no name.
  2. Click on the BSM Map icon from the CI's form.
Business Service Management PRB600641 The Keylines BSM maps are missing the Set as CI context menu option and the Redraw layout menu option does not work on a link.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Open an incident which references a CI.
  2. Open the BSM map by clicking the icon next to the CI field.
  3. Right-click on any node.
    There is no Set as CI menu option below the Add Affected CI menu option.
  4. Select a link.
  5. Move the link.
  6. Right-click and select Redraw layout.
    The map is not redrawn.
Content Management System PRB590472 Expand to fit content sizing property is not working for iFrames.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Log in to an instance.
  2. Go to Content Management > iFrames and click on Order Hardware.
  3. Change the sizing property from Fixed size to Expand to fit content.
  4. Check the ESS page and notice that the iFrame gets cut off.
Data Certification PRB592787 The Certification Task Overdue email notification sends information on overdue data certification tasks to the manager of the current Assigned to user (Assigned to.Manager), but there is nothing defined to grant view access to the manager.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Using a demo instance, navigate to System Definition > Plugins.
  2. Activate the Data Certifications (com.snc.certification_v2) plugin, with demo data.
  3. Navigate to User Administration > Users.
  4. Search for and select Bow Ruggeri.
  5. Personalize the Form Layout, and add the Manager field to the form.
  6. Set the Manager to any ESS user (for example, Abel Tuter).
  7. Click Update.
  8. Navigate to Data Certification > All Tasks.
  9. Open TSK0009064 in a new tab/window: https://[instance_name].service-now.com/cert_task.do?sys_id=ce25bcdf9751300000f8d7b8fa29758c.
    Note that the Assigned to is Bow Ruggeri, so in the event that this task became overdue, Abel Tuter would receive a notification with a link to this record.
  10. Impersonate user Abel Tuter.
  11. Refresh the tab containing TSK0009064.
    No content will display.
Domain Support PRB600502 Domain-separated instances can display an error message, "Your domain has been changed from {0} to {1} because of session timeout" when a user session times out. While the error message may list the global domain as the new domain, users do not actually change to the global domain and cannot see records from other domains.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Install the domain separation plugin.
  2. Activate the domain_select or domain_picker macro.
  3. Log in as a user belonging to a domain.
  4. Go to Enhancement Request > Open and select a record.
  5. Leave the screen on that record for 45 minutes (until session token expires).
  6. Click on another link in the navigator.
    The error message appear as described above.
Import / Export PRB599348 CSV and XML files are not deleted after an import.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Upload an XML file to an instance.
  2. Check the glide/temp directory for the file after the import completes.
Import / Export PRB601339 A field of Type HTML appears blank when exporting a list view to Excel.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Open a Calgary or Dublin instance.
  2. Open an incident form.
  3. Create a new field called HTML Description and set the Type to HTML.
    Use this field to compare to the Description field, which is a string field.
  4. Export from the list view by right-clicking the list header and selecting Export > Excel.
    Note that the HTML Description field is empty.
List Rendering PRB600820 Hierarchical lists hang and then the instance becomes unresponsive.
Mobile Browser PRB600758 In the mobile UI, if a requested item is opened from a reference field on an approval record, then the variables are not shown.
Notifications Email Notification Improvement The glide.email.notification.save_when_no_recipients property has a default value of false.
Notifications PRB599353 For MSP instances, outgoing notifications use the incorrect domain.
ODBC PRB597765 Fix SchemaProcessor to be able to query any table.
Platform Security PRB560649 A deficiency in the caching system prevents cached form views from being cleared when Access Control Lists are updated. Old form views cached before ACL updates can still be presented. This causes settings that should be granted to the role user_admin to be ignored.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Give a non-admin user the user_admin role.
  2. Impersonate that user and attempt to create a user record.
    Note that many fields are read-only.
Reporting PRB594176 Trend reports do not display correctly. For example, the filter produces data from Monday to Sunday but the rendered chart displays data from Sunday to Saturday. Changing the glide.ui.date_format.first_day_of_week attribute has no effect on the selection.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Navigate to Reports > View / Run.
  2. Select Type = Trend Report.
  3. Select Trend Field = date_field per = Day.
  4. Add filter and Order = date_field on Last week.
Web Services PRB600795 Create a delete() @GlideScriptable and a scriptable deleteRecord method for the GlideRemoteGlideRecord scriptable class.
Click the plus for steps to reproduce
  1. Create a script include using the GlideRemoteGlideRecord scriptable object.
  2. Attempt to use the script to delete a record on a different instance.


Eureka
Note: This article applies to Fuji and earlier releases. For more current information, see Geneva Release Notes, Helsinki Release Notes, Istanbul Release Notes,Jakarta Release Notes at http://docs.servicenow.com

The ServiceNow Wiki is no longer being updated. Visit http://docs.servicenow.com for the latest product documentation.



30 Overview

The Eureka release includes enhancements that drive the enterprise service model and improve the user experience. For more information, see:

  • Before Upgrading to Eureka: review key information before upgrading to Eureka.
  • Requesting an Upgrade: review the procedure for upgrading your instance.
  • Enhancements: view new features and notable changes.
  • Available Versions: browse versions within this family.
  • Submit Feedback: provide feedback on documentation.
  • Legal Notices

You can also download all Eureka release notes pages as a PDF.


NOTE: Eureka is now an archived version that is no longer supported.

31 Before Upgrading to Eureka

Review this information before upgrading an instance to Eureka:

  • Customers who use Amazon EC2 or VMware for cloud provisioning must perform additional actions before upgrading to Eureka.
  • Customers upgrading to versions prior to Eureka Patch 2 may encounter issues with email notifications if the Subscription Based Notifications plugin is not active. For details and workaround information, see KB0539070 in the ServiceNow Knowledge Base.
  • For customers upgrading to versions prior to Eureka Patch 2, the UI14 user interface is not enabled automatically. For workaround information, see KB0539843 in the ServiceNow Knowledge Base.
  • For customers upgrading to versions prior to Eureka Patch 3 Hotfix 1, the TinyMCE HTML field editor is not enabled by default. This feature is required to use HTML fields in UI14. For details and workaround information, see KB0540618 in the ServiceNow Knowledge Base.
  • Customers upgrading to versions prior to Eureka Patch 3 Hotfix 1 may encounter issues with visual task boards if the Mobile UI plugin is not activated. For details and workaround information, see KB0541346 in the ServiceNow Knowledge Base.

32 Enhancements

33 Service Automation & Business Management

Facilities Service Automation

Manages facilities requests throughout the organization and enables requests to be tagged to specific locations on a floor plan.

Visual Task Boards

Allows users to organize, modify, and track progress of multiple tasks from an intuitive, Kanban-inspired interface.

Demand Management

Consolidates strategic requests from the business and facilitates the IT investment decision process.

Visualizations

Displays animated 2-D and 3-D visual representations on a timeline for any logical data relationships within an instance.

View more...


34 IT Operations Management

Event Management

Collects, processes, and transforms events from third-party sources into meaningful alerts that trigger ITSM flows.

Chef Configuration Automation

Defines and governs the configuration of Chef servers through the service catalog and CMDB.

Business Service Management Map

Displays CMDB relationships, operational tasks, and business service health in an intuitive graphical interface. Allows users to manage relationships, create personal views, and show dependencies.

Orchestration

Provides new and updated activities for Active Directory, Exchange, and PowerShell, allowing users to build enhanced Orchestration workflows that connect to Microsoft systems.

View more...

35 Application Development & Integrations

Service Creator

Empowers line-of-business service owners to build lightweight, custom request-fulfill applications within an IT-governed framework.

Catalog Item Designer

Provides a simplified interface for creating, maintaining, and publishing items, allowing these functions to be delegated to non-admin users.

Multiple Catalogs

Allows users to group and administer catalog items into multiple service catalogs by business area, organization, geography, or target user base.

Form Designer

Allows administrators to create forms and tables with simple, visual controls.

View more...


36 Platform

User Interface

Improves usability and adds live streaming, document tagging, form pane tabbing, and column header filtering with UI14. Automatically enables UI11 for upgrades.

Surveys

Provides a new survey engine with capabilities to create and send surveys in minutes, add conditional questions, schedule surveys, and limit access to specific users. Displays results on scorecards.

Assessments

Displays results in bubble charts. Allows users to send triggered assessments, create conditional questions, customize assessment appearance, and retire assessments. Supports additional question types.

Notify

Delivers bi-directional notifications over SMS, Voice, and Conference Bridge, and is tightly integrated with workflows and business rules.

View more...
